Patrol the area around the Chocobo Forest and extinguish any remaining beasts you may find.

Marcechamp's men in Tailfeather are in the process of conditioning chocobo young to instinctively return safe to the post if they become lost in the Forest. While chocobos would learn much quicker if they could be trained without any distractions, it is a luxury that the hunters do not have, for far too many savage beasts in the area would love to pick a vulnerable bird clean. /beckon the chocobo to help it learn its way back to Tailfeather while dispatching any predators that may try to take advantage of a free meal.

The eyes of the Dravanians are ever upon our knights, so mayhap it would sully their pride if they were to witness those not of Ishgard's ilk joining our cause. Seek out and slay their lesser cousins in the Churning Mists, that the Horde might bear witness to your deeds.

We dragoons are a proud sort who often charge into the heat of battle, but that is not to say discretion is without merit. When shadows abound, we sometimes make use of wooden dummies with arms and wings manipulated by gears which resemble dragons from afar, to create an illusion of comrades in the vicinity. However, we lack the materials to replicate dragon scales. We seek an experienced adventurer willing to journey to the Churning Mists and skin Dravanians for this purpose..

The Horde and their minions continue to run rampant in the Churning Mists in defiance of Halone's will. Their numbers must be culled, but take care to strike quickly, before their masters hear their shrieks for help.

Man cannot return to the heavens ere the last dragon fall, yet the enemy's numbers only continue to grow. While it has proven difficult to locate Dravanian nests, the younger kin can be found carelessly wandering the lands, made brazen by the safety provided by large broods. Coat the earth in the blood of Dravanian young in the name of the Fury.

A dragon's natural armor may seem impenetrable to an untrained eye, but a true dragoon knows well whence the vulnerabilities lie\xe2\x94\x80a darkened spot, a bent plate, or if one is lucky, a barren patch. These days, too many youngbloods sign up for the training to join our noble ranks without showing a shred of decent talent, hence I have decided to thin out the crop through a trial. If the men can identify and destroy the spots on targets wrapped in scaleskin, they may continue their training. If they fail, they are to relinquish their weapon and accept pursuit of a less virtuous craft. To fashion proper targets, I ask you to fetch me dragon scales of decent quality, and unless you have an army at your disposal, it might be quicker to obtain them by slaying the enemy's biast cousins in the Churning Mists.

A scout tells of a peculiar occurrence in the Churning Mists, in which a dragon employed blasphemous sorcery to beguile wild scalekin. While we know not how many beasts are puppets of the Horde, we cannot ignore the threat they could pose. Slay as many as you can find, but do not allow the Dravanian's minions to cry for help, else their masters may answer the call.

The Haillenarte contingents in Camp Cloudtop desire assistance in reducing aerial ambushes by tsanahales, which have recently found some success clawing out the eyes of those unfortunate knights assigned to patrol duty. The winged beasts around Cloudtop tend to remain in their nest until they strike, but a plump gastornis breast might be just the thing to coax them out. Secure a piece of meat from one of the plentiful birds as bait, then strike down the foe.

Due to a number of troops left bedridden after supping on a stew seasoned with queerly spotted mushrooms, the Rose Knights are looking for an extra pair of eyes to survey positions in the Sea of Clouds and neutralize any threats bearing claws or jaws. Be sure not to overlook any of the areas\xe2\x94\x80the last thing we would want are feverish men dragged by their necks by a gaelicat in the middle of the night.

Every time the Rose Knights demand more foodstuffs in Cloudtop, my head pains as if locked in the inquisitor's vice, as the long trek often renders my caravans scorched, gobbled, or looted scarce before they get to post. Are there not roses that grow in the desert? I would rather have the defense coffers spent promoting the camp's self-reliance than replacing charred cargo airships and shredded chocobos. You there, if you can scoop up lumps of marl of decent quality to treat and enrich the soil in the camp, then plenty of coin you shall have.

In addition to the physical threat posed by their sharp talons and barbed beaks, the winged beasts that roost in Camp Cloudtop pose a grave threat to the Rose Knights' reputation. Armor spotted in cloudkin droppings rather than gore is looked upon as an embarrassment (and takes great pains to clean). The Rose Knights would like to exterminate the beasts altogether and call for a cloudkin-slayer that can lure them out with gastornis breasts and promptly give them what for.

With a string of losses in recent days, the Holy See has declared that there is not enough fervor on the battlefield for Halone's great task and announced an hour of mandatory observance of prayer for all knights until the Fury is sated in their worship and turns the tide of the campaign. However, House Haillenarte's depleted ranks in the Sea of Clouds feel it unfathomable to allow the posts to be unmanned for even a short period of time, and offers to pay trustworthy outsiders a good sum of money to go on patrol and annihilate any threats to security.

column2: Nobody Can Farm Marl, but Marl (L)
column3: Cloudtop's remote location does not allow many opportunities for import of building supplies, especially heavy materials such as marble or concrete. Luckily, clay-like deposits of marl are in abundance in the area and can be baked into bricks for use in building and repairing the walls of roofed chocobo stables and storehouses. Reap top quality lumps of marl and bring them hither, and I will reward you with coin for your labors.

A fugitive that escaped from our grasp some time ago has been spotted in the Dravanian hinterlands. Her body broken and her face scarred with burns, the witch would have been recognizable to anyone had she not disguised herself as a goblin to live amongst the hinterland clans, naught to be revealed until she had been discovered taking off her false mask for a breath of fresh air. I grow weary of the goblins' impunity in attacking our men and harboring a fugitive, so I would employ an adventurer to rid us of the beastmen entirely. Once our path has been cleared and the suspect seized, I intend to peel back the layers of mystery regarding her break from the gaol, fingernail by fingernail.

In our apprehension of a dangerous criminal, a struggle ensued and the cur struck back at one of my fellow inquisitors, who rightfully retaliated by holding a blade to his chest. It did pierce the offender in his thrashing, and a skewered copy of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Necrologos\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 fell from his robe, from whence it had been protecting his heart! The dark tome's binding unraveled in the scuffle, and the pages flew hither and thither. While we have the urgent duty to bring the perpetrator in for questioning, we cannot allow such irreverent filth to remain strewn about. Someone must go back to the Dravanian hinterlands, gather the pages, and rid the realm of any creatures that may manifest.

A morbol's breath is already an extremely potent agent out in the open, ergo concentrating it into a purer form would make it lethal to any living being. The initial research done by the knights' weaponry division shows that morbol breath may be able to linger in a canister devoid of air, which could be fastened to the hull of an airship and dropped on roosting dragons. The scholars of weaponry have only been able to conduct its research from considerable distances and have found the bad breath dissipates too hastily to collect samples. Thusly, they request a live morbol on which to perform more experiments. The monsters can be found aplenty in the vicinity of Sharlayan, but allow me to dispatch some valuable advice before you depart; the last adventurer we hired for the job unsuccessfully tried to bind the thing with rope and had both of his hands melted off by the putrid spray in the process. You might want to try \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03pacifying\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 it first.

The goblins have taken what remained in the rubble of Sharlayan, and gangs of the lawless beastmen have proliferated where dignity once stood. The unbelievers grow bolder every day, flaunting the laws of the Holy See with aggressive gestures. I rarely give orders beyond the walls of Ishgard, yet they tempt me so in their profane behavior, spitting out expletives that tarnish Halone and thus beckon the rulings for heresy. I will pay good coin to the adventurer who can protect the integrity of Sharlayan by offering the goblins the chance of exile from the place. Should they rather choose the sword, show them no mercy.

A lowborn woman approached our ministry and confessed a serious crime committed by her father. Labor had taken the man on a long expedition \xe2\x80\x9cnorth of the western highlands,\xe2\x80\x9d and on the eve of his return, the woman could hear her father repeating mysterious dark words from his bedchambers. Upon inspection of his room, she was horrified to find a torn excerpt of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Necrologos\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 hidden beneath his pillow. We raided his home and confronted him on his heresy, but he ingested the pages before we could seize him, claiming that he had long waited for this moment to allow the great powers of the void to overtake him and inflict hell on earth. The fool did not realize a mortal man does not transform into an unnatural being of the void through devouring its evil words, and his \xe2\x80\x9cgrand transformation\xe2\x80\x9d reduced his cursed body to ash before our eyes. As naught but a ripped excerpt did he obtain, the rest of the tome must be out yonder, and we seek an adventurer to investigate the original location of his place of \xe2\x80\x9clabor,\xe2\x80\x9d most likely in the Dravanian hinterlands, to see if the tome can be found. Should anything suspicious appear in the vicinity, it must be extinguished forthwith.

One of the more colorful Temple Knight commanders has divulged his ungranted wish to tame and ride a morbol into battle, hoping to use the forth-facing toxins to disable any Dravanian in his path. Of course, I disagreed as it would insult our trusted steeds, and showed much skepticism to being able to mount such a beast to which he merely said \xe2\x80\x9cHave men not tamed ferocious coeurls and behemoths as their war mounts?\xe2\x80\x9d I would not be truthful if I didn't say I would feel some sort of gratification to watch him brave the stench and climb the thing. Bring me pacified morbols so I may be successful in proving such folly.

There has been much commotion in the church over shielding the grand spires, yet those priests see not the more pressing dangers in Ishgard's underlying veins. The planks that cover the sewers of Foundation have been gutted by falling debris, and half-wits have been seen throwing gods-know-what into one such reeking chasm. Refuse breeds rats, rats breed disease, and disease is indiscriminate in choosing its hosts, wealthy or poor. A straight plank of cedar lumber is needed to build a temporary pallet until the engineers can repair the mess.

column2: So You Think You Can Lance?
column3: Every Ishgardian is to answer the call to arms in the event of a draconian invasion, yet truth be told, we have not the manpower to hold regular training sessions for peasants. Give a lowborn a spear, and he'll protect his home for nary a bell before he falls. Teach a lowborn to spear, and a militia can be built without spending a penny of the knights' coffers on training or salary (Halone forbid). The knights have found a willing merchant to learn the thrusts and twists of the lance in one go, and he demands a suitable weapon with which to teach the others.

column2: Almost as Fun as Slingshotting Birds
column3: Although the Horde's mindless minions befoul the skies above the capital, our dragonkiller bolts must be conserved for more threatening entanglements with their wyrm cousins. As a productive way to pass the doldrums and keep the clutter out of our midst, the lord commander has decreed that every common man must learn archery to down any smaller fiends they encounter. If every man is to train in the bow, there must be a bow for every man.

Draconian talons scrape along the taller columns of the capital and the knights can ill afford to allow the costly resources of mortar and brick go to the defense of shanties in Foundation when the High Houses raise such a din of their own welfare. Naysayers further grumble about not enough compensation put towards grave damage to the areas around the Brume, to whom I would send sturdy stacks of cedar lumber to silence their discontent.

As the bulk of the Temple Knights have been charged with protecting the High Houses and officials of the Holy See, the order has warmly welcomed the notion of a militia composed of Ishgardian civilians, which would keep watch over areas that the knights may be unable to defend in the event of an invasion. Dozens of men have already expressed their willingness to stand up against those who mock their city, and are eager to undertake simple training in how to use a lance. It takes not a weapons master to thrust a pugil stick at a Dravanian attempting to enter a home, especially if the tip is stamped in mythrite.

While the knights have been mandated to arm the common man with tools of the archer for defense of the capital, 'twould seem the more desperate of the lowborn have taken to breaking up their cedar bows to be used as firewood to heat their homes. I care not if those ungrateful wretches shiver until their lips turn grey, for this is scarce the time for selfish actions as the dragon curs breathe upon our gates. The bows will have to be replaced, along with a decree that any who use the tools of the state for unintended purposes are to be locked in the gaol to ponder their obstruction to Halone's divine wish.

What started out as a simple sponsorship for an archery competition by the Congregation has turned into a grand affair as the High Houses caught wind with their natural instincts for rivalry. The contest has been rendered exclusive only to highborn archers, and will involve all forms of moving targets and dazzling displays of accuracy on chocoback. Quite a show will be had, which means an equally suitable prize must be given to the winner. I seek none but the finest carpenters to submit a bow design of their choosing to serve as the grand prize, and the carpenter of the winning bow shall be paid handsomely for it.

It has been said the best deals are struck during a session of fishing, and it just so happens yours truly was invited by Baron Thieveneux of House Dzemael, a staunch and wealthy patron of the Temple Knights to partake in such a leisure. Outside of the capital? Halone forbid! No, no, I have been invited to the manor's expansive ponds, stocked with the best and built by Dzemael hands. There is much profit to be had for the coffers from a leisure such as this, so I find myself in need of a fine cedar fishing rod...though not \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03too\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 fine, mind you. I would yield the fattest carp to the master of the House of Rook as I try to catch even bigger fish.

column2: A Reward Fitting of the Faithful
column3: Able-bodied men border heresy when they refuse to join the knights in the battle against the Horde. They could learn much from Jasper, a deaf-mute with a twisted leg who wakes before sunrise to spend the day hammering wooden planks and roofing destroyed buildings. Though born of such circumstances, he is deserving of the Temple Knights' appreciation, and a just reward to boot. A blessed cedar necklace should guide him in his prayers.

column2: Win One Bow, Get Three Free (L)
column3: 'Twould seem that the winning bow-maiden of a High House-held archery contest has become enamored so with her prized holy cedar composite bow that she would like to commission you to carve three more in the same likeness. One to gift to her lord, one to present to the church as an offering to the Fury, and one to mount on her wall as decor. You have either quite the admirer or an exploitation of an inflated ego.

In concurrent fishing sessions with nobles in each of the High Houses, I have been able to secure double the patronage of last quarter in addition to supplemental equipment for the volunteer militia. To commemorate the auspicious business, I would send a cedar fishing rod to each of the lords in the hopes that they will take the bait on invitations for more excursions.

After the siege on the capital, the repairing of the harrowing havens of the Brume was left to those who live there. Although their woodworking is not the quality of noble engineers, their labors towards rebuilding Ishgard have not gone unnoticed, and I would like to reward them in some way. Mayhap they may find some solace in the greater power of Halone if they were to be given cedar necklaces to use in their prayers.

The hour is near for the final trial for the students of the scholasticate chosen to use their wisdom and healing prayer for the sake of Halone on the battlefield. The purification ritual must be conducted using a rod carved from dark chestnut, untainted by hands other than the carpenter who has crafted it.

I know of a frail old woman in a Coerthan cabin who spent her days spinning cloth for war banners, and preferred to sit windowside and watch the passersby as she worked. While the Calamity had spared her in the fortune of her remote location, it confined her to stare at the glow of the hearth instead, reminding her of the burning hellfires of that day but remains as the only place where her fingers will not become bitter and numb with the cold wind's bite. Build for her a spinning wheel made from dark chestnut, wood that will not catch fire easily should bits of kindling snap and hiss out from the hearth.

The Dravanians ever harry my wagons, and I have already lost too many this moon. Metal cargo holds would surely keep against the fiends, but there are none to be had with the necessary resources relegated to greater concerns. Thus I must make do with wood. Mayhap chestnut lumber, as it forms nasty splinters when broken, I am told. If even a few dragons are forced to limp away, I will at least have that satisfaction.

While many seminarians of the Saint Endalim Scholasticate show great aptitude for defensive and restorative magicks, they must also be capable of employing the destructive kind as the situation demands. We have need of three suitable rods for the upcoming trials to join the vaunted ranks of the Temple Knights.

The frigid temperatures of Coerthas build character and the withal to brave the elements in combat, but even beasts know to retreat to shelter when the wind becomes so cold that breath turns to icicles. A handful of infantrymen prefer to spend these volatile days keeping the company of an elderly spinster, who dedicates herself entirely to weaving the material to be raised high as our flags in battle. They ask for dark chestnut spinning wheels to assist the crone in her commendable efforts.

As I lamented the loss of another wagon to the Horde, a curious report came across my desk regarding the efficacy of bitterdrake as a deterrent against dragons. A splendid idea came to mind, that we might refurbish the wagons with dark chestnut wood treated with bitterdrake oil, ensuring any dragon that attacks our caravans will suffer a most unpleasant surprise. Deliver to me the finest lengths of lumber that work might begin posthaste.

column2: The Long Armillae of the Law
column3: The master carpenter of House Dzemael has outdone himself with designs he assures me will better withstand a Dravanian assault. What mockery 'twould be if the dragons could not destroy a wooden building with their infernal breath! I grow excited at the prospect and would show my support with a gift of chestnut armillae carved with the Rook's sigil.

I have received unfortunate news that one of our supply vessels headed towards Falcon's Nest was assailed by a wyvern, littering broken bows and bodies upon Coerthan cliffs. The wife of a perished merchant grits her teeth for vengeance instead of compensation, and has requested a quality hallowed chestnut composite bow, the same stock lost along with her beloved. When asked why she wanted naught but this, she expressed she wanted to spend the rest of her days drifting from vessel to vessel in the skies, tracking the very wyvern that robbed her of her former life so no other will feel the pain she has endured.

It's simple knowledge for any greenhorn in archery to keep the arrow at the height of your eyes as you aim, but a poor lowborn bastard training for the volunteer militia let an arrow fly too close to his face and nearly took his own eye out with the feathered end! Useless, the lot of them, but it can't be helped especially if it gives the poor a reason to help the campaign. Craft him a hallowed chestnut mask of aiming so he is less like to hurt himself and more like to let arrows fly in the face of nightmares with scales and teeth.

House Dzemael's master carpenter at Falcon's Nest has requested a set of chestnut armillae for every member of his guild, vital equipment for protecting the wrists of the artisans from protruding nails, splintering wood and the unexpected axe to the wrist. The craftsmanship of Dzemael goes without rival, hence I would refuse them not for what they desire if it means an even sturdier barracks.

column2: A Sky Pirate's Life for Me (L)
column3: Following a tragic airship ambush by wyverns, a fellowship of Ishgardian merchants have decided enough is enough, and rally behind an enraged widow to form a wandering brigade of armed escorts eager to dock any ship to splatter the decks with wyvern gore. The Temple Knights welcome any man or woman that holds such hatred against the foe to take to arms of their own accord, so I would ask you make them bows with tightened strings that sing as the curs fall from the heavens.

column2: To Protect My City, I Must Wear a Mask (L)
column3: The ranks of archers in the militia have been steadily increasing, and they demand wooden masks with which to \xe2\x80\x9cprotect their identities.\xe2\x80\x9d I suppose civilians fear such trivial things as a Dravanian outflyer remembering their faces. If they were to perform their duty properly, the last thing the enemy would behold would be the scarlet pool of its own blood. Nevertheless, we seek to fill their order if it will keep their fervor burning.

In the aftermath of Vishap's assault on the Steps of Faith, there has been a flurry of plans to rebuild Ishgard's defenses, one in particular calling for the construction of a new ballista watchtower. The urgency of the situation calls for vast amounts of lumber, and of a kind sturdy enough to support a two-tonze dragonkiller. Bring us as much birch as you can so construction can begin posthaste.

Ordinary arrows do little more than tickle our scaled foes, and many a foreign sellsword learns this too late, and to their sorrow. Nay, in order to do real damage, the arrowheads must be made sharp enough to shave with. To achieve the edge we seek, we're always in need of grinding wheels, and no ordinary ones at that.

The dragoons tasked with aiding House Durendaire in retaking the Stone Vigil have proposed the usage of the formation known as the Barbed Adamantoise, in which men join shields and march in unison with protruding spears to deter attack. Adamantite spears are one of the few weapons strong enough to shatter Dravanian skulls and will prove worth a trial run.

column2: Built This City on Blocks and Soul (L)
column3: The Temple Knights are more concerned with security and stability and would settle for a complete lack of decor, even if 'twere an utter eyesore. Yet the Holy See views the world in a completely different shade, and the new ballista watchtower to be built in the capital has fallen under the eye of the theocracy, which requests for adjustments to the building plans\xe2\x94\x80more dignified, more majestic, more sacred. An expansion of the tower means an extensive amount of wood to build it, to which I would request your carpentry skills. Make haste, for the Vault has already announced a mass coinciding with its completion to stir the hearts of the people.

The Skysteel Manufactory has made vast improvements to our arrowheads, marrying traditional archery with machinistry, and the lord commander has ordered production to increase threefold. More sharpened arrowheads means a new line of dragonscale grinding wheels with which to whet them, and a cofferful to whoever can deliver them the swiftest.

House Durendaire has had much success in recent days in spilling the brains of mewling Dravanians across the chambers of the Stone Vigil with its shield-to-spear Barbed Adamantoise posture, and seeks to increase the squadrons of knights tenfold using the tactic. The Horde has amassed more followers to challenge the knights in the Vigil's courtyard for what could intensify into an all-out bloodbath. Pray deliver adamantite spears in peak quality as soon as possible or else the High House is not foreseen to triumph.

House Fortemps, in its queer taste for the exotic, has initiated a bizarre exchange which allows for one outsider\xe2\x94\x80a pugilist from Ul'dah\xe2\x94\x80to come to teach the men his art while one of our machinists travels abroad. The student has been here nary a fortnight and makes high-handed demands for his lesson, in this case, a belt that can properly take a kick in the gut. I'll not entertain his request by having our best tanners labor beyond courtesy, so he will have to make do with whatever you can muster.

Bards regale audiences with the tales of victories, failures are carried by whispers and mourning, yet none recall what happens on the field in the immediate aftermath of a battle. Out of sight, out of mind, as one would say, but when the chirurgeons have done all in their power, a special mortuary team arrives\xe2\x94\x80primarily lowborn and devoid of talents in combat\xe2\x94\x80to salvage ammunition and decide proper treatment for the war dead, and they have much need for attire that can endure the roughness of the terrain. One has been sent on a mission to a particularly swampy corner of the Dravanian hinterlands, and has placed an order for new jackboots before departure.

The baseborn cannot be trusted to take up the bow for anyone but themselves, and I expect half could not tell a quiver from a wineskin. 'Twould prove a blessing if any could puncture the wings of the smaller outflyers while the knights handle the wyrms of monstrous size. Standard gloves of archery should steady the arms of the uninitiated and see the arrows closer to their marks.

Pugilism has piqued the curiosity of some of the knights, and through the coffer provisions list, I have seen an unusual increase in orders inked for belts abetting the art. However, the leatherworkers of Ishgard have tossed the list with scorn, barely holding their tongues of condemning the knights to using outside influences. Foreign arts should be trusted to a foreigner, I suppose, and who better could I ask than you?

column2: These Boots Are Made for Hawkin' (L)
column3: 'Tis with great sorrow that I have received a letter from a commander who writes that we lost scores of men in the western highlands during a skirmish with an enormous dragon. While the fiend was vanquished, the carnage was such that the deceased cannot be returned to the capital, and we have no choice but to bury them in the field. Other armies may leave their dead to rot as they press on, but Halonic law states that all knights are to be prepared for their ascension to Her halls, and thus I have asked for a handful of priests to join the mortuary contingent, who must needs replace their thin slippers with something more formidable for the journey.

The edict for a volunteer militia shall afford our knights much-needed relief, yet the Pillars have seen less enthusiasm than one would desire. 'Twould be unthinkable to allow the commoners of Foundation to keep space on the roofs of the manors with their unkempt miens, so the maidservants have volunteered to learn archery\xe2\x94\x80on the condition that they wear soft gloves, as their hands must be kept soft and free of dirt for accommodating their lords and ladies.

column2: You Could Say It's a Moving Target
column3: Swift and cunning bastards wyverns are\xe2\x94\x80as if the rats of the sky can read our minds. When one veers left, our archers let fly on the right. It stops its wings and drops towards earth when it hears the ballista's twang, only to pick up again after the bolt is set on its path. A seasoned knight can adapt to these maneuvers, but should a greenhorn make a misperception, it could mean death for an entire squadron. Wyvernskin is what I need, stretched across a frame and tied to a bateleur's neck for target practice.

A Convictor by the name of Lioneleaux has gained some fame among his kind for felling a much-feared wyvern captain that left only men's heads to fall from the clouds. His accomplishment is to be praised, for the death of the guts-griping monstrosity has opened supply routes once closed off due to the threat. To honor such a momentous victory, I would have a \xe2\x80\x9clion\xe2\x80\x9d mane of wyvernskin fashioned for him in his family's name.

There are some who swear that the skin of a dragon will writhe ever so slightly around your arms when its brethren are near, for the flesh yet yearns to join the roaring song though the spirit may be in the hells. Whether there is truth to this or not, it serves to keep soldiers ever alert to the dread tightening of their dragon hide tunics.

The knights train their archers using an enormous mannequin in the form of a Dravanian subordinate, hung from a chain and filled with Dzemael tomatoes in the heart, head and abdomen\xe2\x94\x80should an arrow hit its mark, one would know straight away with the resulting spray of juices. Unfortunately, too many good shots over time also make for a mushy mess pouring out of the punctures, attracting flies and stray animals. The old skins on the mannequin must needs be replaced with fresh ones, to which I would entrust you the task.

A lone Convictor knight has succeeded in slaying a deadly wyvern, and I would bestow upon him a reward befitting his accomplishment. The helm will mark him for a hero among his brothers and sisters, and it is my hope that they, too, will be inspired to great feats in the name of the Holy See.

This volunteer militia about which the Holy See has been so enlivened is starting to look no more than a regular mercenary unit, and their demands are becoming such. I've warned about giving the commoners equal armor as the men who train as deathbringers, but it seems to fall upon deaf ears so long as it fulfills the word of Halone as every Ishgardian as warrior. I have no choice but to serve up wyvernskin belts on a silver platter, but I would complain not if you chose to withhold quality.

The village of Hemlock in the western highlands of Coerthas was thought to be abandoned, but rumors have surfaced that men are attempting to reclaim the ruins for sinister purposes. The inquisition would like to send one of their own to investigate, disguised as a farmhand returning home. She must needs look convincing, and thus requires suitable garb.

I know of a hunter in Tailfeather who has perfected his posture on loosing arrows from chocoback with such deadly accuracy that he could be confused for a right cavalier...if it were not for the dismal lack of barding on his chocobo. 'Tis a pity for both, as the bird would be more like to cooperate if it were not kicked and scraped on the sides by shoes made of hard tack leather. Deliver me a pair of soft dhalmelskin boots so the poor thing will have some sort of protection.

When we make our rounds to the Congregation's training facilities to choose hopefuls for the Knights Dragoon, I have noticed the uptick in lowborn numbers among the new recruits. While it is good to give them the benefit of the doubt as their desperate situation allows them to take more risks than their highborn counterparts, sense it does not make to give candidates quality armor from the start\xe2\x94\x80they have a nasty habit of dropping.

To prevent the ruins of Hemlock from turning into a nest of Dravanian harriers, the Holy See has ordered refugees currently residing in Foundation to return to the western highlands and restore their village to pre-Calamity form. Sew up sets of Hamlet's traditional garb to be sent to the refugees' places of residence in Ishgard as a message marking the end of their stay.

A small cadre of hunters in the Chocobo Forest had caught an unbeliever with knife in hand ready to slit the throats of the hatchlings being groomed for divine service. When she fled through the trees, they gave chase and kept her deposed until the knights arrived to serve the Fury\xe2\x94\x80by hanging the witch from the bough of a caelumtree. The hunters are looking hungrily for a reward, to which I would commission you thus for boots a might nicer than the pieces of fetid old leather hanging from their ankles.

Children who lose their fathers to the jagged maws of Dravanians make fine candidates for the ranks of the dragoons, for theirs is a special contempt which cannot be found in the hearts of ordinary men. The commanders can oft tell who they are, and thus seek to nurture that hatred through painful sessions which force them to relive their nightmares. The ranks will be thinned out sure enough, hence we must make use of breeches tough enough to withstand the grazing of sharp teeth, but expendable enough for those who crack from the pressure.

One of the spryer recruits for the Knights Dragoon has bested a lesser drake that wandered into field training, and his comrades have mockingly titled him \xe2\x80\x9cwyrmslayer\xe2\x80\x9d ever since. Feh. How generous naivety is that they would sooner piss themselves upon encountering a formidable wyrm of Nidhogg's choosing. Nevertheless, the lad does deserve some recognition for his feat. Present me with a pair of dragonskin wristbands to commemorate his small victory.

A knight who sustained dire injuries when he fell from a cliff would have perished had it not been for a passing Halonic priest, who offered a most unusual \xe2\x80\x9cprayer.\xe2\x80\x9d If I did not know better, I would say he has a true healing gift\xe2\x94\x80one that is often reserved for chaplains. I would much like to express our gratitude for the knight's rescue with a pair of dragonskin gloves to aid him in his future endeavors.

I'm sure you've seen what a herculean task it is to slay a dragon mightier than the ones that mindlessly roam the land. Though its magnitude allows for expectation on its movements, a draconian of that size has power to shock a soldier still. With the help of the Skysteel Manufactory, we have been undertaking the creation of a full-sized model in the likeness of a large Dravanian, complete with wooden joints that move as a dragon would, a torch pipe to breathe fire as a dragon would, and now, it must needs be armored as a dragon would. Bring us enough circles of dragon leather to form the neck.

Oh, how I do enjoy putting fresh-faced dragoon hopefuls in their place\xe2\x94\x80especially those prized peacocks who strut about and boast of the unnecessarily ornate helms that their noble fathers had bestowed upon them. So foolish are they to forget it is the wrists at which a Dravanian snaps, for manipulating the slicing of the lance. After all, what good is a head without wrists to command? The gudgeons will learn soon enough as their training proceeds, so I would commission you for sets of dragonskin bands to prepare them for their rude awakening.

It would seem the priests of the Holy See have taken to more desperate measures since fewer Ishgardians have been seen worshipping in the church, and have taken to the streets to torture a dragon-like scalekin in chains wearing naught but their acolyte robes, showing if one believes in the superior powers of Halone, they will come to no harm in their massacre of the dragons. As a hospitalier, I cannot condone these actions, but there are none to object to the will of the Holy See and its ministries. I suppose I will need extra sets of gloves on hand to address the emergency surgeries that will follow.

We have commissioned the Skysteel Manufactory to build a life-sized model dragon for use in drills. Alas, while the machine functions as it should, its appearance leaves a little something to be desired. In order to enhance our knights' training experience, we require a goodly supply of dragonskin to drape over the body.

column2: Starting Off on the Wrong Foot
column3: Through the fire and flames of their rigorous training, even those candidates of the Knights Dragoon who show much promise are ill prepared for the final test. It is not a matter of skill but awkward gait, as they are unaccustomed to the burden of the traditional plate bestowed upon them. Before bearing the lance, the candidates must know the weight of serpentskin armguards pressed against their muscles, thus quality work is required.

A greenhorn bowman tied a folded Ishgardian battle standard to one of his long arrows, and loosed it from atop a knoll nearby so that it stuck in one of the wooden frames and unraveled in its beautiful blue beauty. He meant it to serve as a warning to the Horde skulking the corridors that House Durendaire would have its retribution without question. The knights were motivated so by his boldness that they commenced another offensive soon after, taking back two of the strongholds. Such respect for the power of morale is deserving of reward, and I would pay you to fashion a belt of serpentskin for the lad.

column2: It Will Knock Your Socks Off
column3: One of the esteemed chosen custodians of the arcane barrier of Saint Daniffen's Collar has completed his initial assessment of the damage, but not without a minor setback. It would seem in his boiling frustration at the few barriers left intact, he kicked one of the remaining active wards, delivering a shock to his system that knocked him straight into the air. Luckily, he was able to recover with Halone's good graces, but his boots had absorbed the impact from the barrier and were promptly torn to shreds. He sheepishly asks they be replaced.

At last, the final trials for the Knights Dragoon are upon us, and this year's candidates have proven to be the most propitious in quite a long time\xe2\x94\x80all from fine bloodlines, all burning with acrimony towards their scaly adversaries. They call the trial a \xe2\x80\x9cmock battle,\xe2\x80\x9d yet the only thing mocking about it is that their adversary is not a full-grown wyrm. They will have full reign to demonstrate their skills, thus the birth of a dragoon merits celebratory armor for use in the test.

column2: Do My Little Turn on the Stonewalk (L)
column3: As House Durendaire claws back into the Stone Vigil inch by inch, they have been successful in securing one of the wide stone awnings within the keep, and archers of reputable skill are being summoned to prevent the dragons from regaining territory. Such a task calls for armor fit to keep the bowmen's backs straight for bells at a time. If you can bring me belts by twilight, I shall pay you double\xe2\x94\x80slow shipments should stand not in the way of Durendaire bowmen launching arrows into the throats of our enemies on the eve of a prosperous advance.

The acolytes of the scholasticate left with the daunting task of repairing the broken wards of Saint Daniffen's Collar have seen their numbers depleted due to a recent hushed purge of heretics among their ranks, those whispered to have given secrets of how to release the wards. It is most unfortunate that the remaining faithful find themselves collapsing with aether's toll on their systems in lieu of the absent members. I pray you, sew me pairs of boots imbued with supplemental properties to allow them to stand their ground, and stand it tall.

The knights in recent weeks have been dedicating more consideration for unspeakable events such as a full invasion of Ishgard, what it would entail, and what would result. For instance, in such a place as Foundation, one can imagine the chaos that would ensue should smaller wyverns land and chase women and children into the narrow alleyways, ripping them limb from limb. Spears and arrows would be no match for such a gruesome scenario, but a katzbalger in hand could be quite useful in dispatching these foes.

As part of a military arts exchange facilitated by House Fortemps, a pugilist from Ul'dah requests a set of arms to demonstrate the...primitive power of his discipline. I've not ventured to Ul'dah in many years, and as you are well aware, we have not the conception of such ungraceful weapons. I suppose you are the only one whom I could task with creating a pair of patas that bear resemblance to that of which he speaks.

The outer shells of the ballistas are sure as steel, but just as men without armor, the inner workings of the dragonkillers are delicate and fickle. A dragonkiller that cannot spin and shoot as swift as the Dravanian soars could mean the deaths of hundreds of men. We must find a worthy blacksmith for hammering out mythrite bearings\xe2\x94\x80bring me smooth samples and I will see to it you are well paid.

The communities of Foundation have been granted permission by the Holy See to conduct defensive training for children too old for wet nurses yet too young to join the knights' ranks. I have not the slightest idea who will be teaching these children to properly use weapons, but the Holy See has spoken, and we are in need of sets of katzbalgers with short reach and small grip\xe2\x94\x80simple enough weapons for the little ones.

An Ul'dahn pugilist under sponsorship of Fortemps seeks to teach the knights what use hands can be in the case their weapon is disarmed. I scoff at the notion of pummeling a dragon at close range like some angry yeti, however it would seem the men are enjoying the lesson, much to my chagrin. They have started asking for ridiculous claws made of mythrite, to which I'll task you to create for the sake of the lesson. But Halone help me should this thirst for foreign weaponry go too far, as I will have no qualms about putting an end to it entirely.

Very clever the Dravanians were in their most recent invasion, for they took special care to disable the dragonkillers first, knowing the ballistas could turn the tides rapidly. While many of our beloved contraptions of death have survived the brunt of the flames and crushing weight, the more sensitive internal gears have been ravaged beyond repair\xe2\x94\x80bearings that allow the contraptions to pivot on command must needs be replaced.

I am in need of a tool of execution for a heretic found to be in perjury after dragon spawn was found in her cellar. An axe, you say? Perish the thought! None of the forsaken should be afforded the luxury of a quick clean death for offending the Fury. A longsword wrapped in barbed twine makes for so much the better, as the barbs interfere with the blade, unraveling and entangling with muscle, allowing for three whacks. That should give the convicted enough time to contemplate their birth, adolescence, and death before reaching the gates of the first hell. Mayhap you disagree with my methods? 'Twould be best to satisfy with taking coin than through the looking glass at judgment upon yourself.

Rumors have surfaced of heretics using the knights' supply caravans as a way to quickly move from operation to operation, traveling in barrels and crates in the hull. The Holy See has granted permission of ordinary supply crewmen to arm themselves with a weapon that does not encumber their regular chores, provided any heretic discovered is to be put to death. A pair of stilettos should serve the purpose quite well, as knives can be used for rigging, rope-cutting, and gutting any heretics found belowdecks at a moment's notice.

No matter how enticing a plump dragon's flesh may seem to a unit of starving knights, one must never consume its flesh for it amounts to both treason and madness with both a just cause for beheading. Knights stationed in places of the far corners of the map find good meats hard to come by, surrounded by creatures of tough hides and lean composition. A utensil made from mythrite may allow for easy cuts to be carved out and boiled into a stew, and I would have you design a possible prototype to be added to the mess kits.

These are dark times that enshroud Ishgard, when heretics arise from their feathered beds to stir the hearts of the purest, causing the Pillars to clamor that the sinful tongues of the unfaithful must be held accountable. In the name of those vulnerable, we Holy Inquisitors have appealed to the Holy See to grant us powers of an even swifter trial. As they have answered our wish, we require longswords to carry on our persons at all times for particularly sudden sentences. Should you craft us these weapons of justice, I would ensure you are paid very well for your services.

column2: Stepping on My Heart with Stilettos (L)
column3: A group of questionable gentlemen seem to have boarded a personal air vessel of mine in the Sea of Clouds and asked to be armed with three pairs of stilettos in order to leave the ship and its very supple and desirable passenger unharmed for more interesting work in killing our foes as per Halone's divine command. I would ask you most graciously to provide them to me so they can get to work immediately. Blackmail? No, no. I've just not the time to deal with such trifling matters with the intensity of focus on the war effort!

The Temple Knives, culinarians sent to serve men in the field, have reported that their blades are dull, their ranks fewer, and the snapping drakes near their campfires are increasing in number. The Knives would much prefer to be supplied with cooking utensils that are forged from the same materials as the weapons wielded by their comrades, as they are wont to gut Dravanians as any other Ishgardian. Provide me with a set of mythrite knives suitable for cutting up dhalmel shanks and dragons alike.

column2: I Could Feel That from Here
column3: One can find many uses for skins stripped from the bones of our enemies\xe2\x94\x80armor, decoys, wiping at the latrine. While one can use their imagination in desecrating the flesh of a dragon, there are not many knives as capable of cutting through such tough material as titanium. A knife smithed with a titanium edge so sharp that the dragon will still scream from hell as it feels its flesh get sliced into pieces.

I heard the carpenters of House Dzemael decided to have a competition on one of their days of rest to see who could cut through a bough of birch the fastest using naught but a rusty amateur's saw\xe2\x94\x80the winner's branch was finally lopped off at the four-bell mark! While it was all in good fun, I do think he should be rewarded with a cleaner cut since the blisters on his hands will not heal any time soon\xe2\x94\x80a saw of hardsilver should do most nicely.

The Skysteel Manufactory requests a smith worthy of creating some sort of flintlock that will accommodate their machinists' newfangled art. Such weaponry is a mockery of the gifts of war that Halone has bestowed upon us, and thus the blacksmith guild that serves the Temple Knights has declined to take up the offer to forge the strange contraption. I suppose an outsider like you would probably fare better at granting the manufactory's request. I'll even pay you coin for it so they will stop whining in mine ear.

Halone's fortune favors the brave, and the slaying of a great draconian foe has given us the bounty of bone and scales! But we must make haste to peel the hides off before the bateleurs eat their fill\xe2\x94\x80such valuable material must not go to waste when it can be cut and sewn into garments that look upon the Dravanians with scorn as we storm them in combat. We need creasing knives forged from titanium, on the double!

column2: I Came, I Sawed, I Conquered (L)
column3: Through our failures do we persevere, and retribution has always been Ishgard's greatest weapon. As piles of shattered dragonkillers lay at our feet, the See's craftsmen are sworn to utmost secrecy as they toil from dawn to dusk working out the skeleton of a new design that will stand the stress tests of both fire and claw. As scrolls of each new prototype fill the planning room, the models dull the teeth of the carpenters' handsaws, thus replacements are in order for them to continue their sessions.

Machinists. Bah. While we've no qualms about introducing advancements from the Skysteel Manufactory to our arsenal, any knight worth his salt knows the weapons ordained by the Fury Herself\xe2\x94\x80the bow, the sword, and the lance\xe2\x94\x80are the ones most like to please the goddess in rendering a more painful and excruciating death. Alas, I have an accord with the manufactory on technology, yet they wish to display the pomp and pistols of their machinists in battle. I'll humor them this once, but I'll not have our blacksmiths distracted from their crafts of traditional weaponry. Thus I would rely on you to provide them with whatever armaments they desire.

Only a handful of dragonkillers have special chain pikes and are structured in such a way that keeps them mobile, yet ably bolted to the ground at a moment's notice. Both the pike and the locks must be made of titanium, for if the dragon is too strong, the ballista will be lifted into the air; if the chains are too weak, they shall break and set the monster free\xe2\x94\x80as was the case when the dread Vishap broke through his fetters. Bring me ingots of titanium with which to craft the pieces.

The restoration of the capital would proceed a great deal quicker if only the handsaws would cooperate. You would think the See's slack-salaried blacksmiths would be able to create aught to accommodate the climate turning wood into ice, but innovation has never been their strong suit, and what good is a handsaw if the teeth are worn down to the nub before a single run through the grain? Forge me a sturdier tool, I will be sure to make it worth your while.

The Temple Knight blacksmiths may be mere craftsmen, yet their work does not escape the strict oversight accorded by the Holy See. One priest has been a thorn in my side, miserable of his duty and worries more of dirtying his silk robes than unceasing production of equipment. Disgusted by the ash and soot of one of the shops, he declared the smithing tools to be \xe2\x80\x9ctainted,\xe2\x80\x9d which could merit an inquisitor visit. Luckily, the artisans were merely punished with one-hundred recitations of a famous passage from the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 and the tools discarded. Somehow, I feel giddy at the prospect of their new tools being replaced by an outsider's hand.

The order has come down from on high for a drastic change in the arsenals of the dragonkillers. Every pike made of wood and iron is to be replaced with those made entirely of titanium. As if such resources are abundant enough to grow on trees! I have the difficult choice of having less bolts than before or swallowing my pride and rounding up more blacksmiths from outside of Ishgard's gates to complete the entire order. Pray do not disappoint me.

column2: I'm a Lumberjack and I'm Okay (L)
column3: The terrain has become enshrouded in more peril since the Dravanians' emboldened assailed upon Ishgard. While the foe is more like to ignore those but Temple Knights, it would seem that they have developed quite the taste for unarmed purveyors of botany, and their bodies ravaged with fang and scorch marks alike tell the tale. 'Twould seem men of any Discipline of the Land cannot survive without a much heavier arsenal, thus I desire a blacksmith who can use their talent to create axes which might be used to fell both trees and dragon alike.

Ever since the catastrophic events which emboldened our Dravanian adversaries, the smithing guilds have been working their hammer arms to the bone and the hammers themselves to the nub in answering the clamor for better weapons. While struggling to fill the never-ending orders of the Temple Knights, they barely have enough time to repair their own tools before the next arsenal is sent out. There is much coin to be had for a freelancer who can forge them durable hammers\xe2\x94\x80titanium may last longer than others.

Under normal circumstances, one would laugh at the notion of a bowman or maiden standing their ground against a towering champion of the Horde, yet that would be underestimating the arsenal at the Temple Knights' disposal. Our arrows are made not from wood, but materials harder than diamonds\xe2\x94\x80a well-placed pierce through a dragon's throat could just as easily incapacitate the foe as one of the dragonkillers! Such shafts, however, are saved only for the most elite marksmen and women, as such, they pay handsomely for adamantite with which to outfit their arrows.

The ballistas are much fretted about with care, yet the most vital work comes at dawn when the contraptions are coated in a thick sheet of ice, sealing the gears and immobilizing the pivot chambers. The faster an engineer can pick off the large chunks, the faster the dragonkillers can feed metal into the bare chests of sin. For that, the sharpest dolabras are desired.

Following a failed attack by the Horde, a wounded dragon flew as far as the central highlands before falling to earth in a narrow mountain pass, blocking the road. One of our knights, properly equipped, should be capable of hacking the frozen carcass to pieces and reopening the pass to trade.

When an archer releases an arrow, it must be done with some certainty it will hit its mark as the stock is limited. The elites must be even truer to hitting their marks with arsenal of such rare commodity that even time is lost with one release of the string, for it takes days to create a single arrow of adamantite that pierces even the strongest dragonscale. As a result of the Horde's invasion, my need of adamantite nuggets is acute for those elite bowmen stationed along Ishgard's walls.

column2: The Nightsoil Is Dark and Full of Terrors (L)
column3: Mayhap more darker purpose than prank, someone has poured buckets of sewer water onto rows upon rows of dragonkillers, knowing full well that by morning they would become encased in thick filmy sheets of ice and piss. 'Twould seem punishment for one engineer to break all of the weapons from their statues of scum, therefore sets of dolabras are needed for an entire team to pick out the ballistas.

Oft mistaken for hills or debris left by the Calamity, frozen corpses of the Horde are blights on the land and bitter reminders to the knights who lost brothers and sisters in battle. Provide for them swords made of adamantite to remove the eyesores and allow them a peace of mind.

I have always said one cannot trust the baseborn too heavily with the divine task of Halone, for their upbringing in such squalor claims their own welfare before even the Fury. We caught one such man last week, in the midst of him selling his provisioned tassets to settle the debt of his induction into the ranks. He has since been beheaded, so I would ask you to craft another set of tassets to replace the stock lost.

The grand gates to the city must be able to open and shut at a moment's notice, barring any monstrosities from barreling at the city proper. In light of the devastating consequences that could occur from a Dravanian invasion, the engineers under the auspices of the Temple Knights have commenced replacing the bolts and rivets that hold the vital physical barriers together, and coin will be had for the armorer who can produce mythrite rivets to deny the Horde entry to our sacred city.

No sooner than the dragon takes the air into its lungs that knights must raise their shields to protect them from the following conflagration. Alas, in the unfortunate event that Ishgard is once again under siege by the Horde, every alleyway is the front line, and ill-trained men are more like to burn in their homes than face the fiends head-on. I seek to restore confidence in the volunteer militia by providing them with scutums resistant to the flames, in hopes that when the time comes, they'll have enough wits to use them.

Within the span of one moon, three men of dubious class have reported their mythrite tassets missing, stolen, or beyond repair, and I somehow sense foul play at hand. Swindlers must be punished in giving away the property granted to them to fulfill the Fury's divine wish, and I will have not the knights' armor used for wicked purpose. If it's tassets they want, then you shall craft them for me for good coin. But this time, I will mark them thus and see if they end up in the dark corners of the Crozier, and the culprit shall answer with their hands.

While dragons are wont to attack with fire, fang, and claw, the more brazen of the beasts use their bodies as battering rams. In this way have too many of our watchtowers been reduced to splinters. The new towers we are building must be stronger than the old, and to this end we need stronger rivets, among a host of other materials.

Shields, they insisted. For what reason would the merchants and labormen of the Brume require that which even a fledgling knight would struggle to put to use? I oft wonder what will become of this voluntary militia the Holy See has whipped up into a froth\xe2\x94\x80while the extra security is appreciated, the first shields out the guild should be given to those who have dedicated their souls to combat. Alas, the commoners have appealed through the Holy See, knowing well we cannot refute the law of the land. As our official armorers are already over-taxed with orders for more \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03imminent\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 combat, I would commission you to craft shields you feel the commoners deserve.

Treks into the Sea of Clouds are long and arduous, and the less that our men need carry the better. Hence, the order seeks to commission an armorer who can forge a shield for battle that might also serve as a source of light after dark. Coin paid for services will prove substantial.

As a student of medicine, I tended to scoff at practitioners of alchemy. It was not a forbidden art in my youth, yet it seemed no more than mere biast oil extraction when compared to those righteous trades condoned by the church. Then the capital's doors closed and I soon realized how the same utensils of alchemy were used in the experimentation of new remedies, now exotic commodities in Ishgard's isolation. Produce for me, if you would, an alchemic device worthy for my trials in distillery.

column2: Pan That Laid the Golden Egg
column3: After several flagons of ale, a House Dzemael blacksmith made a wager with two Temple Knives that he could forge liquid gold in their pans as one would cook an omelette. 'Twas trickery, however\xe2\x94\x80no sooner did our men agree that the blacksmith pulled out a wedge of cheese and popotoes. Needless to say, the Knives are in need of new pans\xe2\x94\x80and one bandages for his broken knuckles.

War games that pit neophytes against one another are essential to the training, but it should not cost the Holy See more than what they're worth. Youthful vigor is all well and good, but dented bucklers pile up like plywood, and the recruits respect not the weapons nor the time and coin it takes to forge them. Serrated blades along the edges of a shield should turn horseplay into hard discipline for fear of a nasty slicing.

The constant flow of ailing men and women from battlefields and manors alike provide a catalyst for greater resourcefulness in the practice of medicine. I oft wonder if there are paths to be forged along the lines of alchemy, of plant and animal biles that could be put to widespread use in rarer illness. Mayhap an outsider such as yourself could present me with some prototypes that could separate the extract of plants to allow for a wider berth of medicinal discovery.

Field culinarians, or the \xe2\x80\x9cTemple Knives\xe2\x80\x9d are a curious breed, gruff in spirit and able to prepare a feast with minimal ingredients and tools. They are also prone to violent action should anyone intrude upon the sanctity of their kitchen. Their frypans caliente make fearsome weapons, for I have heard tales of bandits who dared to steal foodstuffs fleeing in terror, clutching their charred faces. One such incident has prompted a request for new pans, as the residue stuck to the bottoms of their current ones is interfering with their cooking.

As dragons fly, the heights will provide them with protection so long as our dragonkillers cannot reach them. How far a bolt flies is entirely dependent on the strength of the cog-gear that holds the tension and propels it into the dragon's soft underbelly upon release\xe2\x94\x80the more tension it can hold, the more like it can destroy a dragon's perception of \xe2\x80\x9cflying to safety.\xe2\x80\x9d The methods of creating the cog-gears is a matter of secrecy, yet the coffer of the manufactory would swing wide to an armorer who could bring them titanium nuggets of worthy quality with which to research how much tension it could hold.

column2: Someone Put Dung in My Helmet
column3: The candidates for the Knights Dragoon are always under intense pressure that leaves both their heads and faith pounding by the end of a training session, to which some forget even the most common of sense. One of the youngbloods was daft enough to place his sallet next to a roped and very well-fed chocobo during his training respite. Needless to say, no amount of water or prayer is going to get the unholy smell of droppings and shame scraped out of the metal. He will need a replacement helmet posthaste.

In memoriam of our knights' heroic foray in the Autumn War against the Ala Mhigans, the Holy See is sponsoring the annual reenactment with knights solely from the four High Houses, two houses on each side. The recreation of the historic battle is in name alone, as the knights never cast off their reputations and the victorious side appears to change every year. Roughhousing is expected and thus quality armor is needed so that the knights may save their intended armor for our Dravanian foes.

The wyverns mock Ishgard, sailing their wings with pride as the wind carries them hundreds of malms into the air out of reach of the precious dragonkillers. The manufactory has completed experiments with lighter metals with great success, and so the order has been carried out for all of the ballistas in the capital to be replaced with cog-gears birthed from titanium, strong enough to launch a bolt a hundred malms high without stripping wood from windlass. Let the Dravanians smirk no longer, and let the skies forecast downpours of blood from on high.

As their training forces the Knights Dragoon to respond violently to the screams of dragons, the candidates to join the ranks prefer to use sallets of titanium. Rumor has it that not only is the headpiece as light as a feather, but as the wind blows through the crevices, it mimics such a wail and allows the wearer's hatred to course through their veins tenfold at the mere sound.

The annual reenactment of a famous Ishgardian victory against the barbarians in the Autumn War is nigh, and the knights of the noble houses have begun their training exercises for period-accurate field warfare. The strategy used in the historic battle differs somewhat from those in our holy duty, as we charged men rather than beasts. Hence the noble knights participating in the mock battle have requested armor made of titanium\xe2\x94\x80light enough to practice running laps for the charge, but still strong enough to withstand a lance thrust.

There have been whispers in the Pillars of an assassin, some say sent from a High House, stealing away in the night to the manor of Haillenarte and trying to stab a knight clad in naught but her nightdress. The blade was diverted by the woman's squire who took the knife in the knight's stead, saying, \xe2\x80\x9cSo as long as Halone blesses your sword, your death shall be by dragon claw and not by a sullied man's hands.\xe2\x80\x9d The blasphemy-monger was swiftly dispatched and the boy treated, but so moved was I by this remark of virtue that I will pay a purseload of coin to the armorer who can craft me a set of tassets to honor the squire.

If you do not cut off the disease at the source, it will continue to spread and manipulate the other parts of the body. We have known for quite a while about Lady Iceheart's treacherous group of knaves, yet it would seem that one faction has splintered off into their own ideology, calling themselves \xe2\x80\x9cpeacemakers,\xe2\x80\x9d yet wearing masks to conceal their identities. The heretics love to use honeyed words to reach the ears of the optimists, so there is need to eliminate the \xe2\x80\x9cpeace\xe2\x80\x9d at any cost through their own devices. I want you to forge a proper scouting mask for me, and tell not a soul if you value your tongue.

The knights assigned to capital patrols are oft dissatisfied with their delegation, for it does not compare to those brothers who brave the heat of dragon fire. Hence the fools are more like to vent their vexations ale-sopped, pummeling lowborn ungrateful for their service. Unfortunately, one such brawl has left a peasant less one wife after being struck in the face with a gauntlet. In customary circumstance, the knights would be pulled out into recess, yet with the threat of a Dravanian siege looming over my head, I can afford not to dismiss men of considerable skill. In lieu, I must keep them chastised and the baseborn quiet and sated with his demand\xe2\x94\x80armor fresh from the forge.

The squire of House Haillenarte who saved his master from assassination is quite vulnerable to retaliation from whomever sent the behest. I have heard rumors of an unwritten code of the High Houses, judging that the person who protected the target of an assassination must have revenge enacted upon himself as well as the original prey, unless the hit is called off as too bothersome a task. 'Twould make sense as so frequent are the vindications that even the nobles themselves bat nary an eye. Nevertheless, the Rose has ordered an extra squadron of bodyguards to be sent to protect the boy, and they are in need of tassets with which to prevent from a gutting themselves.

My comrades in justice are adept at slipping in and out of the shadows\xe2\x94\x80to catch a heretic, one must mimic their ways with a stout enough resolution to remain untainted and see to the end that the heathens fall hundreds of feet to their death. We are in need of disguises, yet I trust not in the armorers of Ishgard for this task, for there may already be an infestation among their ranks who would sooner spread the word if it meant impeding our righteous work. I entrust it to no soul but you outsider, for if the conspirators anticipate our arrival, there could be but one source.

The ranks of the volunteer militia grow steadfast, with more peasants signing up for equipment by the bell. As knights train in order to grow into their shells, I have my doubts that naught but those who have delved in the smithing trade have enough meat on their arms to carry a bucket of water, let alone a bastard sword. I need someone who can forge something lightweight for the arms that will not hinder the militia slow as tortoises should the Dravanians storm the gates.

One of the knights who will storm the Stone Vigil has been building muscle in a bid to make the next siege the last. While his zeal is more than welcome in the impending victory, the growth of his muscles has split the mail links in the seat of his trousers and thus he has need of an armorer able to fit his girth into a new set of adamantite chain hose before the next operation commences.

Among the aspiring Knights Dragoon are a talented few who practice jumping attacks in equipment crafted from adamantite, the weight of which will help them to crush a dragon's skull as an eggshell. Alas, one such youth misstepped during his training and landed among the crags, breaking both his legs and armor in the impact. Though his injuries will heal, he requires a new pair of leg guards, and I would entrust none other but a skilled craftsman with the task.

Some may grouse that their children will have grown before the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Protector\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 once again claims the skies as her own. I pay them no heed, for the more time spent, the more like the ship will be unassailable. A handful of rivets is requested to anchor the mast to the baseboards, but take care to craft them from materials which will stand to wear.

The forces of House Durendaire are the cornerstone of our efforts at the Stone Vigil. To help them continue their fight against our sworn enemy, the Holy See would dispatch a shipment of supplies. Among various other materiels, it is understood that they have great need for stout leg guards suitable for heavy infantry.

The hopefuls of the Knights Dragoon are near the end of their training drills and have grown overconfident with their newfound power in the dragoon jump. A handful boast themselves invincible, and that they are more than ready to practice the jump in heavy adamantite armor, just as those veterans among the ranks. I have warned them that none but a true master of the art would be able to perform the jump with precision in such heavy armor, yet they heed me not. Very well then, the fools will know their folly once removed from the lists due to shattered ankles.

In the art of airship building, even the most miniscule details must not be overlooked. For all of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Protector\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03's grandeur, 'twould be all for naught should the hull give out in mid-flight whence the air thins, a common fatal mistake caused by cracks between loose bolts. Cloudtop's finest aviator will not stand for chance. We will need adamantite rivets, and plenty of them.

A knight patrolling the Brume was approached by a lowborn girl who exclaimed that her parents had given her a beautiful present for her nameday. Although she had been told to keep it a secret, in her excitement she revealed that it was a draconian rosary. Needless to say, the girl's parents will not be returning by supper. I would send her some sweets as thanks for her service to the Holy See.

Upon returning to Ishgard from a Dravanian campaign, a knight learned that his young wife had been killed during the wyvern attack and buried in his absence. His sister seeks a culinarian who can recreate the dish his wife often used to cook for him\xe2\x94\x80a warm plate of rolled cabbage, so that he may mourn her in his own way before returning to the fray.

I care not for men who cannot pull themselves out of their own misfortune, but sometimes the best way to a man's obedience to the war effort is through his taste, and the baseborn find much to hunger for these days. The Holy See is hoping that the knights might be able to entice some of the poorer to the ranks, so I am searching for a dish sample that would whet the appetite enough to consider taking up the sword, but not aught so rich to get them addicted to the life they cannot have. As a master chef, you would know better than I.

A group of street urchins did not go unnoticed as they watched me give a fig bavarois to a child as a reward for pointing out blatant heresy within the walls of Ishgard. I told them there would be plenty of the sweets for any who could point the finger to more heretics so that they could be punished. With gratitude to the little ones, the knights have rounded up seven accused since the last bell, including one amongst themselves! Bake me their due sweets, and the inquisitors will be happy, the children will be happy, and for the moment, all will be safe in Ishgard.

Knights who do not fear death are the most like to be returned the Fury's embrace rather than their families. Although their brothers and sisters may have risen honorably to walk in Halone's halls, those who survive will allow for more dragons to fall at their hands and will return to the capital for a reprieve until they are dispatched once more to the campaign. Returning knights should be given a homecoming that will make them feel more at home with their loved ones, including dishes they have not supped upon in some time.

Men who have not the coin for bread to fill their empty stomachs are more inclined to fill themselves on the bread of the forbidden word\xe2\x94\x80indeed, those who fall to their knees in poverty would rather blame the church on their ill fortune rather than their failure to put their prayers to deed, and thus Halone sees them not worthy of Her mercy. Nevertheless, the knights are more inclined to see heretics as more detrimental to the war effort than the hungry, thus the lord commander has a plan to serve the needy to rekindle the faith of the people in the Fury (and possibly recruit more men on the side). I pray you find me a dish that may be worthy of the lowborn's tastes yet for wide provision among the capital.

Culinarians may see fermented butter as no more than an ingredient for a variety of dishes. Yet knights in backwater locales often use it to shave with knives\xe2\x94\x80an alternative to the expensive creams of the capital. Fermented butter has a rich scent and salve-like texture, making it ideal for this purpose. A shipment has been requested by our forces stationed in the Dravanian forelands, to which I would consult your service.

Second Commander Handeloup has a tendency to remain shut up in his room for days on end, planning and provisioning the next supply caravans in the far reaches of Dravania. He had not requested it, but I think it wise to prepare him a snack to quell his empty stomach devoid of heaviness that would drift him into sleep's embrace. A simple leavened muffin should suffice.

I have been informed that House Haillenarte has agreed to have its contingents partake in joint training exercises with House Dzemael, and my hope is fixed that the supper that follows will allow for more amity among the two houses. Finding a dish that would dull sharp tongues has proven difficult, but I am confident dhalmel gratin would suffice, with thick consistency of the Dzemael variety and game familiar to Rose Knights.

The infantrymen are accustomed to braving the elements and finding themselves yalm-deep in mud, sand, and dragon corpses. Yet you would be surprised what improved hygiene does for the morale of the troops, as even those who march to their deaths would prefer to greet Halone with their beards in some form of upkeep. Hence I ask for a large quantity of fermented butter not for culinary purpose, but for the men stationed in Cloudtop where scarce water cannot be used for a clean shave. It may not be the finest of lathers from inside the capital, but Halone has always taught us to be humble in our appearance and overindulgent in our combat.

The night patrol of Ishgard is no easy task, as when heretics are most like to slip through the gates and cast their sinister plots upon a sleeping city is during the witching hour. Since the Calamity, the frigid temperatures at night have made the surveillance all the worse, as the patrolmen shiver in the wind as they walk through the streets. Exhaustion sets in as dawn approaches, and the men oft look forward to lamplight upon the warm, chewy muffins awaiting them. Supply me with the baked goods so they may find hard-earned rest on a full stomach.

What were expected to be joint drills in good faith among the knights of Haillenarte and Dzemael has manifested into measuring the others' strength and speed, with more men joining in by the day. Halone forbid if the nobility put more energy into slicing up dragons than boasting who has downed more of them. I can only hope that dinner will briefly hush the incessant churl-hurling\xe2\x94\x80heaping servings of thick dhalmel gratin should keep them chewing for a while.

While I care not for the meetings at the Congregation on matters of Ishgard's defense, I recognize the gravity of their outcomes and informing the High Houses and the church proper. Therefore, I find myself quite annoyed when one of the Vault's cardinals insists on bringing a pouch of imported Gridanian walnuts, cracking the shells open with his teeth during the deliberations. The noise is most distracting, so I would have you prepare a substitute that would make for a quieter refreshment to be placed at his seat ere he enters the room.

The training for the volunteer militia composed of Foundation residents was meant to be brief, yet one of the more rotund merchants is already whining he cannot continue running laps around the forums without a proper meal in his stomach. Provide me with a canteen filled with emerald soup to shut him up, but pray make the broth thin\xe2\x94\x80if he can't hold it in, it'll be easier to scrub off the cobblestone than solid food.

The Holy See, tiring of the same old culinary fare, is requesting outside assistance in coming up with new tastes for a banquet on the eve of the anniversary festivities of the Autumn War. The best candidate dishes will receive a good handful of coin for their efforts, and I suggested your name as one who might whip up aught promising.

I am a man of action, and much prefer directing the excitement with the contingents on the battlefield to the mundane strategy meetings in the capital. Listening to the houses droll on from their gilded cages of things nary a relation to the war front cannot compare to stomping Dravanian entrails with your boots with blood splashed across your face. What's worse, the meetings run well into the night and there is no time to break for supper. As I am in charge of preparing the next exchange, I seek a culinarian who will provide me with a meal that is easy to nibble on without making too much noise\xe2\x94\x80the nobles do hate when their prattling is interrupted.

Blasphemy is a ragged peasant swinging a mythrite sword as a drunk with a broken bottle. Without some slight oversight from the Temple Knights, these commoners of the volunteer militia are more like to cause damage than help the effort. No, they must be introduced to more intense standard training...and with any volunteer training comes more dropouts leaving with fancy weapons. Lunch must be provided to sway them to stay, I suppose. Boil me tureens of emerald soup to keep them running.

While battles that spill the blood of dragons are the most highly regarded, any Ishgardian victory is worthy of Halone's pride. The anniversary of our venture into the Autumn War is nigh, and knights from all noble houses will participate in the annual memoriam reenactment of the great battles against the Ala Mhigan barbarians.
