Some of the most holy in the church are expected to observe from canopied pavilions, and it seems they look forward to supping on cuisine reminiscent of the season in which the battle was won. As I recall, you are a fine cook of dhalmel fricassee, which would suit the occasion quite nicely.

I ask this favor not in my capacity of Temple Knight commander, but in confidence as a personal matter. My daughter pursues a suitor who mentioned once in passing that he is quite fond of fish dishes. Naturally, she wanted to create for him the finest dish he had ever tasted, but used grass carp in her main course, a fish so bitter it would cause one's face to pucker up as soon as tasted. A father should only get involved if it were a matter of threat, yet I feel adding a few drops of hollandaise sauce to the dish might be able to mask its putrid flavor.

A commander on the battlefield was caught in a crossfire by a ball of fire that burned a hole in his neck. The wound has since closed up, but while he is on the mend, there is much he cannot consume without his throat burning and gurgling up foul humours. I request a serving of frozen spirits, concocted with fresh fruit so the frigid beverage will numb his throat while assuring the proper intake of nutrients.

A priest has arranged for an audience with the lord commander regarding an urgent matter. 'Twould seem the church is looking to enact self-flagellation as part of the training exercise of every knight in the order. While I am all for religious devotion, I can see the lord commander grimacing at the thought of adding it to the already intense drills. I implore you to conjure up seafood delicacies of such fine taste that the priest's opinion might be swayed during the exchange.

In a particularly brutal scuffle with heretics inside the capital's walls, a knight came out victorious and his comrades wanted to cook a banquet to celebrate his name. It is mere bells before the food is to be served to friends and family, and I was invited for a sample taste, to which I regret. The taste was so unholy that with one bite of the gratin, I swear my tongue burned like hellfire. I ask for a culinarian with a skilled hand to mask the horrid taste and save the banquet in the one way I know how\xe2\x94\x80drown everything in hollandaise sauce.

Those hapless enough to breathe in dragon fire are left with seared throats and are unable to consume ordinary food for moons. In order to provide them with sustenance while easing their hurts, we typically prescribe a mixture of frozen mashed fruits, glasses of which we require posthaste.

The strategy meetings between the Holy See and the Temple Knights make for quite an awkward exchange, and the gap of perception is even wider come supper. The high cardinals always insist on naught but the finest gourmet dishes served on silver platters with La Noscean wines drunk from bejeweled goblets while we knights have been disciplined to live on stale bread and our own determination. Mayhap you can whip up a course to bridge the two.

The lord commander is a remarkably modest man, and shirks all splendor of the fine cuisines of the capital, instead choosing to break the same bread as any common soldier. Yet I know the one pleasure to which he indulges himself\xe2\x94\x80I have seen him put a dash of rich birch syrup in his morning tea, ever so subtly. He may complain if he were to know of my intention, but as there are few delights he can have in the immense burden he carries, I would have none other than the most exquisite drops for his lordship.

column2: Soup That Eats Like a Knight
column3: I'm sure you have been here long enough to know what makes a good meal, one that warms to the bone and puts a fire in the belly. Emerald soup, you say? Feh, drink down that thin broth and you'll be pissing green in nary a bell's toll. Clam chowder with a thick slab of stone-hard bread, now that's a stout soup for a warrior. Ah, now that I linger on it, my stomach has started yearning for it as the night grows colder. Bring me a hot bowl of the stuff and I'll give you a handful of coin for convenience.

A fountain of stamina is an understatement of what is required when repairing and replacing the components of the ballistas\xe2\x94\x80testing the tension, checking the chains and hammering down the base means long periods of standing or crouching under the giant contraptions. Although one can see the sweat on their brow, their obsession with the machinery and its inner workings offers them nary a moment's rest. Some would even prefer to continue to work while they eat, thus I would like to deliver them liver-cheese sandwiches that can be devoured with one hand while the wrench turns in the other.

The lord commander is fond of adding a few drops of birch syrup to his morning tea, so I had imported a small potent bottle of fine vintage for his enjoyment. Alas, in receiving dire news of another assault of Svara towards our barracks I spread the map across mine table, knocking the bottle on the floor. Only after the matter had been taken care of had I noticed the dogs lapped up the lord commander's sole luxury. I aim to correct mistakes no matter how trivial, so I would ask you to procure three bottles of the rich stuff to ensure it does not happen again.

At last, the newest round of inductees for the Knights Dragoon have completed the final trial and a send-off banquet is to be held in their honor. While the finest chefs in Ishgard are busily preparing the main entrees for the feast, there are not enough hands in the kitchen to cook up the appetizers. I would employ your talents to come up with a hearty dish that reminds the dragoons of home whence they may not return to in a long while, if at all.

column2: Better Come Back with a Sandwich (L)
column3: The ballistas on the Steps of Faith require more repairs than originally anticipated and the Skysteel Manufactory has sent a number of machinists for the task. After many bells of cranking, ratcheting, and oiling, I am certain a hearty meal would give them heart and much-needed relief besides.

Notices have been posted hither and thither for a wanted heretic hiding among the baseborn; yet it seems there are those who would still protect such a sacrilegious traitor. Upon passing by some of the posters, I notice many scratched up, torn. There are even those who have been defiled with coarse graffiti about the priests and their poor mothers. If the flea-bitten mutts intend to mock me, then I shall have need of mythrite ink, whose properties allow it to project beyond lesser inks which have been applied over it.

I oft considered the entities summoned from grimoires as innately heretical, as it was mostly those who wished to unravel Halone's will who used them in their minatory schemes. Yet in recent years, I have seen many who use the power of the tomes while invoking Halone's will, and I start to wonder whether the arcanic spirits themselves are not vile of mind so long as they can quicken the death of the unbelievers\xe2\x94\x80fight fire with fire if you will. Procure me one of these summoning grimoires so I may have it inspected by the scholasticate.

Despite its rather unpleasant origins, void glue is an essential tool for the forging of weapons, including the signature polearms wielded by the Knights Dragoon. As the forges of Ishgard have been burning day and night, they oft run out of the stuff and have taken on extra hands willing to produce the valuable adhesive.

Not only do I have my hands full handling the bureaucratic entanglements under emergency, but now I hear tell of a string of clever forgeries of said edicts making their way around the supply lists, with some of our best weapons going Halone knows where. 'Twould seem the culprits are connected somehow to the blasted notion to arm the baseborn with more than they deserve. The guesswork will have to be done by my assistants\xe2\x94\x80I have not the time to worry about weapons that could so easily be identified and apprehended. However, I have great incentive to replace all of the official fountains with mythrite ink, not so easily acquired thus less like to be forged.

column2: Summoning the Courage to Be Different (L)
column3: While Ishgard's scholars are quite adept at manifesting Halone's blessings from their ancient grimoires, summoning an entity from a tome is something that had fallen entirely outside the realm of permissible magicks, as heretics oft use them in their occultist plots. However, with more liberal interpretations for the sake of our advancements in the war, the scholasticate under the auspices of the Holy See has been granted special permission to experiment so as long as they are wrapped in the skin of a fallen dragon to remain faithful to the teachings of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03. They request three volumes at once.

I recall the first drastic change of clime, when the High Houses had trouble with renovating their manors to adapt to the new normal. The wooden planks of the residences were originally held together with nails, but the pieces soon shattered in the coldest of nights. Since then void glue has served much better, yet requires a fresh coating every few years to ensure our lovely lords and ladies don't see their own breath in their beds. The manor of House Fortemps is next on the list for a renovation.

column2: Can't Sleep, Inquisitors Will Eat Me
column3: A man accused of lying with a dragon has lingered in the confessional for nearly four days. My thought is if such claims are true, his spirit should burn so brightly with the dragons' lust that he would require no sleep for days, a common symptom\xe2\x94\x80or so scripture states. He remains lively still in his deprivation, occasionally pounding the door and screaming out his innocence. I tire of his claims in the face of the hard evidence, hence I beseech you to produce for me a grimoire with a high level of aetherial conductivity to lull him to sleep. Permanently.

column2: Steeling the Knife, Steeling the Mind
column3: The chirurgeons of the battlefield are equipped with the best tools Ishgard can provide, but these instruments can only be used a certain number of times before they become prone to contamination. The specialists who forge their medical utensils oft imbue them with magical properties that keep the chirurgeons' minds sharp and focused on the task of healing the wounded, and they request bottles of dissolvent of weak quality for the replenishing of supplies.

As the time to raise new knights draws near, our minds again turn to the words of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 that mark holy water as the sweat of the Fury's brow. It is this, Her gift of succor, that the highest of clergymen need for the ceremony, to bathe the blades of the valiant young and welcome them into the fold.

With the good graces of the Temple Knights, an entire den of snakes has been discovered through an intricate ring of finger-pointing, leading to the arrest of an entire lesser house under the provisions of guilt by association. However, there are simply too many family members to question at once to enable a \xe2\x80\x9cspeedy trial.\xe2\x80\x9d Thus we harbingers of justice request grimoires of potent writing, made from dragonskin in accordance with Halonic law, but that also store up an incredible pool of aetheric energy for every lie the heretics spew forth.

The chirurgeons in the theater of the forelands are always overburdened with treatments due to the proximity of the Dravanians and their rage at the incursion of territory. Until the supplies are able to reach the knights' stronghold, they have not the time for fresh surgical tools and request three bottles of the weakest mind dissolvent in substitute so the surgeries will have at least some form of sanitary protection.

A bevy of women and children burst into the church in hysterics, having been showered by the blood of a dragon felled by a ballista strike. Wailing that the dragon's essence may have been absorbed into their skin and turned them against the Fury, they have been bowing unceasingly in prayer for nearly a bell now. As a member of the clergy, I could not possibly forsake them in their time of need\xe2\x94\x80and when they are so willing to pay the proper fee for a cleansing ritual. Forsooth, bring me holy water and I shall reward you thus.

Oh, if 'twere true to say that an airborne dragon who has taken an arrow to the wing will never fly again. Alas, if the beast is not annihilated posthaste, it will crawl as a serpent to lie low for days until the membranes heal themselves anew. A damnable trait in warfare, but a blessing in disguise for craftsmen, for glue made from dragon wings still slowly mends itself well after the fiend expires\xe2\x94\x80bonding easily and reforming over time. Such valuable material is always in short supply, so should you be able to concoct a batch, I would pay you rightly for some additional stock.

It is of paramount importance that we protect our people from corruptive foreign influences and indulgences. Yet every now and then, our scholars have need of the unconventional. As interpreters of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03's word, they are permitted to request these tomes from other lands. I would rather sate their curiosity for the aberrant without encouraging them to venture beyond our borders, and thus ask you to create such that will not provoke such curiosity.

The cardinals' bedchamber doors are inscribed with an intricate series of wards to protect them while they sleep from heretic throat-slittings, and the Holy See is known to pay large quantities of coin to keep these wards properly maintained. After hearing some rather salacious gossip regarding a cardinal locked out of his bedchambers (and a young lady locked within), the arcane \xe2\x80\x9clocksmith\xe2\x80\x9d has beseeched me for a bottle of hardsilver ink, the aetherial conductivity of which quickens the pace of enchanting and disenchanting the wards.

While the chain pikes of the dragonkillers can pinprick and barb into spine, there is naught to say some form of bonding glue cannot be applied to the tip to deny a dragon the opportunity to rip out the stick with its teeth. Mayhap it be a matter of irony that wing glue procured from dead Dravanians would be most like to bring about their downfall? I grow giddy with the prospect\xe2\x94\x80bring me some at once!

A group from the scholasticate have announced their intention for a field excursion to search for ruins in the remote areas of the Sea of Clouds. One can only imagine the ravage that could be done to the pages of our ancient books plucked from the comfort of their dry, preserved shelves to be taken on such a journey. 'Twould cost more coin to repair the damage to our holy library than to just set them loose with a set of tomes referencing the same scripture. Provide me with codices wrapped in dhalmelskin, far more impervious to melted snow with pages that may provide the troupe with knowledge of the lands beyond the gate.

Time is of the essence when it comes to repairing the arcane barriers of Saint Daniffen's Collar, and the founts of mythrite ink the scholars use have already run dry in the first round of spells. Hardsilver is thought to attract aether quicker than others, needed to meticulously bind the wards using the ancient incantations of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 murmured by the scholasticate custodians. Thus more founts of ink have made their way to the provisions list to which I would give utmost priority\xe2\x94\x80for a commission premium, of course.

As if it were not luck enough to be caught unawares, an aevis ravaged a knight's side and breathed its dark magicks into the wound. The unfortunate soul was retrieved from Falcon's Nest by his brothers and brought back to the infirmary, yet his mouth has started foaming and the wound at his side has turned purple, bubbling and festering from the dragon's bewitching. Though I have not seen it myself, some say the guttering of the aevis will drown out Halone's voice of reason, commanding his mind to murder. Unless someone can produce a bottle of hallowed water with which to purify his wound, we will have no choice but to have his head removed before it succumbs to the aevis's whispers entirely.

My brother in the clergy has shown an innate talent that allows for him to wield a simple stick and, by the grace of the Fury, cure those who complain of headaches. I ask you to provide him with a grander-looking staff imbued with hallowed water so that he may visit the infirmaries of the city-state, granting the sick succor and ensuring the wretched souls that Halone has not abandoned them in their time of need...so as long as they are obedient to the scripture, of course.

The unique climes found in the Sea of Clouds can either remind us of the heavens or cause us to question why Halone challenges our sight with impenetrable mists. It is for this unfortunate reason that the Dravanians prefer to attack on days that our archers' views are obscured by the fog and clouds. Concoct potions of dexterity to keep their eyes dilated with awareness.

Hallowed water is verily the stuff of miracles, imbued as it is with Halone's grace. As a hospitalier, I have seen with mine own eyes proof of its potency to heal. I therefore take great pains to keep enough in stock for cleaning the gravest wounds of my patients. Some recover splendidly. Those who do not...well, at least they will return fully cleansed to Her arms.

There are priests by occupation and there are those who are chosen\xe2\x94\x80to whom Halone has given the gift to provide succor to the sick and blessings to the frail. Alas, we live not in a time of wanton charity, and such precious talents are best employed to heal our knights in battle. Priests who have been blessed so are drafted to serve as chaplains in the field, and these chosen men and women are in need of weapons that will amplify their miraculous powers. Worry not for the smallfolk, for they still have the comfort of scripture.

The archers of the volunteer militia fare not well with their training, and it is worried that they may struggle to hit the bole of a nearby birch, let alone a flying horror ravaging the city. I knew this would not be a meager undertaking\xe2\x94\x80it takes our master archers from childhood to adolescence to learn to keep the bow level and the arrow straight. While we lack the blessing of arcane spells that can set back time, mayhap formidable potions of dexterity can fill in some of the novices' shortcomings.

While I am in charge of allocating provisions and supplies to the many cogs of the giant wheel that is the Congregation, the records are done by an old bookkeeper by the name of Raitemeaux. His shaking hands occasionally topple his inkwell, creating blotches across the pages (which I inevitably must  fill in myself to keep the record clear). Despite his flaws, I would have no other than Raitemeaux entrusted to this delicate position with decades of experience of his employ, and I would ask you to supply him with another bottle of aurum regis ink, which does not deteriorate so easily and makes the numbers in the books more or less permanent.

The tome \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Noble Gold\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 may seem to a layman naught but a hodgepodge of shapes and symbols, yet to those who have been properly educated, it provides a wealth of information regarding arcane barriers\xe2\x94\x80how to construct them, and how to dispel them. The scholasticate's only copy appears to be missing, and while I am sure that it was simply misplaced under a seminarian's bed or some such, it is unnerving that its gap among the others remains. I would have you provide a new copy to fill the old one's place.

A refugee widow from the town of Hemlock approached me when she had heard the Holy See's edict for the knights to return the villagers there in time. She was grateful for the news, but she would choose not to return due to a broken heart, for the hemlock tree which shaded her husband's grave had not only been cut down, but the tombstone had been used for a sacrificial altar and then destroyed. There is naught I can do for a blessed nameplate, but if she is more like to return should the tree be planted once more, then a potent growth formula may allow for the tallest tree in the forest.

One thousand years of war calls for more than ten thousand pages writ of victory, with the war cry of each knight recorded and the thrashes of the Dravanians lost with their last breath. The ancient order of scribes who pen the history of Ishgard accompany the knights on the battlefield as warrior scholars, hence their journals must be able to withstand the test of time. With the rise of every new inducted scribe comes the need for ink that will tell of our never-ending cycle of both hatred and hope.

column2: A Gate Arcane Is Dragon's Bane (L)
column3: The Gates of Judgement stand defiant still, but not without consequence of the mind\xe2\x94\x80it is quite clear the breach has left the people of Ishgard shaken. The wards must needs be erected stronger, and there is but one tome capable of the immense power it takes to build the arcane symbols whisper by whisper, piece by piece. Although an outsider, you are one of the few alchemists I hold in esteem enough to create a copy of such a rare book. Do so, for the safety of Ishgard, and for recognition from the Fury that even unbelievers can be held with some virtue.

On his way to the western highlands, an astrologian dismounting his chocobo had the contents of his pouch overturned, and so had spilled a bottle of growth formula onto the ground. Upon his return three days later, he noted with incredulity that a mirror apple tree several yalms high had sprouted on the path! If the story were found true, the knights could seed orchards to feed our men. But we needs make sure, bring me bottles of the stuff so we may test the soils.

A Dzemael banner woven from velveteen...what in Halone's name was that squire thinking? The Rook's reputation lies entirely on its artisans of sturdy construction and safe fortress, and the blasted fool erects a fire-prone standard near a puk den only for it to explode into flames from a single firespit for all of Eorzea to see. I'll punish the boy later, but for now, I urge you to restore Dzemael's reputation by weaving material for a new standard\xe2\x94\x80one that is not so easily consumed in flames, for your sake.

While dragonkillers are employed to fell large Dravanians, our archers focus on piercing the throats of their smaller cousins, as wyvern spit can be just as deadly as dragon fire. To strike a moving target as thin as a neck, a bowman must focus on proper breathing, aided by the tightness of the belt around his waist. Supply me with a sash so that we may measure the area of tension for our newest recruits.

In the largest infirmary of Ishgard, there is an ancient wooden statue in one of the prayer rooms in the back. It is custom for family members to tie a ribbon somewhere on the statue to aid in their prayers for their kin to become well. With a strange sickness spreading throughout the darker parts of the city the statue has been looking more like a funeral shroud as of late and the ceaseless calls for ribbons seem to be more than the weavers can handle at the moment.

Our standard-bearers are often seated near the point of the commander in order to give signals on the next maneuver to knights hundreds of yalms afield. However, their positioning oft make them a natural target for the Dravanians during a siege. I intend to use this for a more clever ploy\xe2\x94\x80how would the dragons react to a sea of banners scattering in every direction?

The archers of the volunteer militia have been pressing the knights' armory for less flammable armor, yet we have naught to spare for the commoners' pursuit of glory. Yet the Holy See backs their demands, so I would entrust the task to another for an ample amount of coin. For all of their commotion, I do hope equipping them with lavish armor will conjure some merit, for should the militia fail and Ishgard fall, they might hang themselves in their finery to spare them the pain of burning on all sides\xe2\x94\x80save the stomach.

column2: The Road Was a Ribbon of Moonlight (L)
column3: On the battlefield, a chirurgeon need stand apart from regular infantry, which is why we often instruct them to tie colorful ribbons to their arms. At night, however, these ribbons are difficult to see, and our men struggle to tell friend from foe. Rainbow cloth is said to shimmer in moonlight, so I seek a supply of ribbons sewn with the material.

An Ul'dahn Disciple of War under the ward of House Fortemps has been strutting around Ishgard in garb so flamboyant, it would blind the holiest of men! If it weren't for the house's appeals to the Vault for other war tactics, I would have him locked up for disturbing the modesty! The least I can do is have the student wear something blessed by the priests. Then, whatever he may do, he will at least be cushioned with some form of forgiveness for flaunting himself so in the presence of Halone.

Oh, to have been around during the era that Haldrath walked this land, a time when women were pure and wore clothes devoid of flamboyancy and men were driven to prayer rather than drink. 'Tis a pity we have let ourselves succumb to overindulgence at a time obedience to Halone is needed foremost. The Temple Knights seem to reciprocate this sentiment, which is why we will have one of our own accompany knights on patrol in order to \xe2\x80\x9ccorrect\xe2\x80\x9d any who seem more enamored with themselves than devoting their all to the war effort. A notable piece of holy attire will be needed for the man on patrol\xe2\x94\x80honesty is the best policy, you see.

The chief architect of House Dzemael holds his white, frizzled head in his hands so oft these days that one would think him a phoenix in his own right. In his youth, he builds a stone bridge, and the ice of the Calamity cracks and erodes it away. In his adolescence, a village, only for the wooden creations to crackle to embers by a dragon's breath. In his last triumph, the steel walls of a city so grand that its spires near pierce the heavens, only for the Dravanians to set their beady eyes on its ruin. His crafting apron shows his age, and mayhap you can craft him one anew to lift his spirits.

With all the good intentions House Fortemps seems to bid upon, introducing exotic fighting cultures into the holy order of the knights seems all the more threatening than simply turning a blind eye to the hiring of foreign sellswords...and I am appalled that the young disciples of pugilism complain that the uniform of the knights is too cumbersome for their routines. Bah, I will have not the knights bouncing around wearing sacrilegious habiliments. I forbid it. All I can ask of you is to create garments that are somewhat tasteful that remain loyal to the faith.

The inquisition fears that Ishgard's youths are listless, lacking in purpose, and vulnerable to the whisperings of heretics. We will work with the Temple Knights in steering the impressionable away from danger and increase our visibility along the streets of the city. To those ends, we are in need of footwear befitting an office of the Holy See\xe2\x94\x80conducive to the casting of magicks, and current with the trends of the day. Only the most skilled of artisans need apply.

column2: Soot in My Hair and Scars on My Hands (L)
column3: \xe2\x80\x9cSelf-preservation! Self-reliance! By our own hand!\xe2\x80\x9d Such are the war cries of the artisans of House Dzemael who showcase the greatness of Ishgard in our chosen isolation. Yet so obsessed are they with their repairs from the most recent assault that they fail to notice they are clothed in scarce more than scorched tatters. Their resolve is admirable, yet I feel they would serve our realm better should they replace those aprons so black one can scarce tell fresh grease from old ash\xe2\x94\x80mayhap asking them to bathe would be too much.

One of the scholasticate instructors took too literally the scripture which reads, \xe2\x80\x9cMan shall not indulge in excess while Her will remains undone,\xe2\x80\x9d by refusing to change his modest robes for years. While he took baths with some regularity, the moldy stench which wafted from his robes was so overpowering that he was given his own office out of consideration for his peers. By the grace of the Fury, a flamboyant gesture near a lit candle saw it turned to flame and then soot within seconds, leaving him in his altogether. I would rather him not remain so. Yet, if he is to continue his misguided practices, I would have him wear a higher quality robe than the last\xe2\x94\x80one that preferably has the power to clean itself.

The bareheaded senior engineer of the manufactory work crew is currently laboring on the backbreaking restoration of the dragonkiller ballistas. The work remains unfinished, yet the skywatchers tell of a particularly nasty snowstorm on the rise. Knowing that the work cannot cease for the sake of inclement weather, I would have you fashion him a turban to keep his head warm and as a token of my gratitude.

Unfazed by the cold nights in the capital which can freeze water into stone and chill the bones of any who cannot afford the hearth, one of the theologians of the scholasticate has made a request for a pair of fingerless gloves woven from ramie cloth. When I inquired as to why he would request such a thin material, he said it would allow his fingertips to gingerly touch the words of the pages of the holy book, the guidance of which would surely keep him warm. Surely you could grant the request of one so admirable in the dedication to his study of the only text worth understanding in this world.

It seems that the capital has experienced an influx of foreign practitioners of the arcane arts...with their summoned entities in tow, the Count de Dzemael's doing, no doubt. I would not speak truth if I did not say myself and Ishgardians of common heritage are uncomfortable enough with this new trend. While the wielders assure us that they are under complete control and have naught to do with heresy, one can never be too careful, for even hounds lash out at their masters from time to time. I am sure it would set minds at ease if raiments of Ishgardian issue were distributed to such practitioners to guarantee the beasts will not run amok.

The engineers of the Skysteel Manufactory who bear on their shoulders the daunting task of repairing the dragonkillers before the next imminent siege have made an urgent request to the Holy See to allow for their children to forgo prayer school so that they may start learning the trade early. If there were any such time for a swift apprenticeship in cranking windlasses and holding gears, now would be such a time. The Holy See has granted them temporary leave, so I would ask you to prepare turbans fit for the work, but for smaller heads.

The acolytes who remain under tutelage in the scholasticate long after the mandatory elementary lessons on the sacred word can be considered the realm's foremost theological experts. Name any problem and they will quote the correct passage of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 by heart to guide us on Halone's path. Yet there are some among them who hold a special skill that would have even a chirurgeon baffled. The Congregation has noticed through evoking the words of the holy scripture in their tomes, they are able to grant succor to the ailing, and have thus recruited them to the ranks. Provide me with the proper gloves for them to use in their blessings.

column2: A Show of Ice and Fire
column3: One of the priests of Saint Reymanaud Cathedral has a certain flair for captivating the hearts of his flock. While most simply drone on about piety and faith, this man of the cloth is adept at using fire and ice to bring vivid life to the stories of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03. I know what he truly wishes for, however, and would send him a sash of casting as a message that there is room in the Temple Knights for his destructive energies.

column2: Where the Dragonflies, the Net Catches
column3: Falcon's Nest has become overrun with dragonflies which threaten to scorch any crops planted by Dzemael's restoration committee. To keep the pests at bay, the House of the Rook is requesting spools of crawler silk with which to weave nets to capture and dispatch the vermin.

A young lordling in House Durendaire is learning from his cavalier father how to shoot an arrow from chocoback, and shows much promise, despite still being early in his training. Although nearly upon his seventh nameday, he has perfected the marksmanship from an idle chocobo and I would like to give him a gift in commemoration of the milestone of loosing an arrow from a slow gait. Mayhap you can create a vest worthy of his talents?

Not all priests of Saint Reymanaud Cathedral are cut from the same cloth. They may all seek to spread the word of the Fury and guide Her chosen along the righteous path, but some harbor a burning desire to join the fray, and have gained mastery over combat magicks. Now that the Holy See has called them to battle, they are on the cusp of realizing their dreams. Craft them sashes so they may fight in service of our glorious city.

column2: To Kill a Dragon on Nameday (L)
column3: The young son of a House Haillenarte nobleman has requested a special present for his nameday: dragonfly hatchlings wrapped in sticky crawler silk nets that the children can take turns having at the creatures with wooden staves. So as long as it encourages the children's hatred towards our foe and possible recruitment into our order later in life, I see no reason why I cannot pay you a cofferful of coin to meet his demand.

Maidservants of the four High Houses have volunteered to offer their services for the Holy See's edict for establishing a volunteer militia in times of dire need, and are willing to take up the bow to protect the roofs of their respective manors\xe2\x94\x80some of the most vulnerable spaces in the capital. I commend them for their bravery, but their serving dresses will provide little protection should the Horde rain fire upon them. I tried in vain to provide them with armor of hardened leather, yet they refused for want of something that doesn't burden their shoulders so.

When our brothers and sisters fall in the war against the dragons, it is our duty to honor them as they make their final journey to the bosom of the Fury. To this end, ever do we have need of fine fabrics with which we might enfold the departed.

A septuagenarian woodcutter from the abandoned village of Hemlock lives as a refugee in the capital, yet his granddaughter says he oft dreams of his youth, grumbling he would rather breathe his last breath in the clear air than rot as a stranger behind cold stone walls. The carpenters of the capital have long purchased lumber from the cutter, bows hewn from his wood contributing to the death of countless Horde minions. Stubborn as he is, our city-state is in debt to the old man, therefore I would commission you to sew a pair of the finest work trousers you can muster, so as to remind him of his home.

I have received a missive in testimony of a chirurgeon who was the sole survivor of an attack on a patrol in the mountains, saved from her congregation with Halone for reasons only She is aware. The healer knew they would not be found, and her fallen comrades could not walk in Her halls without the proper arrangements, so in solemn duty, she proceeded to slice pieces of fabric with which to wrap around their heads, covering the eyes. She continued her task until she was discovered almost naked by a wandering karakul herdsman. With her recovery and her comrades given a proper funeral, I beseech you to make her a beautiful sash cut from the best cloth so that all will know of her bravery.

An ill-fated excursion to the Dravanian forelands by a foolhardy young captain led to a scout's discovery of the bodies\xe2\x94\x80charred, brittle pieces of the knights they once were. He said 'twas a great wyrm, yet I know too well there would be naught but dust and ash if that rang true. The unit must have been caught unawares. Nevertheless, the brave souls are deserving still of the high Halonic funeral procession for knights killed during the divine task, enshrouded in chimerical felt, and brought home to their families with dignity.

A lumber town Hemlock was, as the wealth of trees in the area amounted for a prosperous community. Since its villagers fled, there has been an increase in scavengers from other remote cabins and villages and 'twould be not fair to allow the boughs to be picked apart with not so much as a twig for the war effort. Hence the knights will be sending a team of botanists to reap the abundance of wood before all that remains are twisted stumps, and require gear proper for the job.

I have discovered that there are nights in Coerthas where the air grows so frigid that once their fires grow dim, the keepers of the infirmary in Camp Dragonhead have been wrapping the fading coals within their sashes, leaving small burns and welts on their stomachs. As provisions do not allow me to give them more wood for their fires, so I would discreetly send pairs of sashes woven with chimerical felt so that their pride is kept intact.

Lord Jannequinard de Durendaire has a true love for angling, so much so that he was once given a pair of gold fishing goggles encrusted with precious jewels as a gift. Unfortunately, upon reeling in a rather large cloudfish, the slippery bugger smacked him in the face, and his gilded goggles fell down the cliffs into the great unknown. It could have been much worse, with the cloudkin taking him down into the depths, yet it is undeniable that there is no getting the headgear back. I wish to send him a new pair as a get well gift for the welt on his cheek. Mayhap with your talents you can design him more practical ones that will stay on his face in the event of another fin-slapping.

One of the newest inductees of hospitaliers has recently experienced the first loss under her care, a frail son of the lord of House Fortemps. The first death is always the most unbearable, yet the Fortemps family allows her no rest, blaming the poor woman for their son's early ascension. She has spent recent days withdrawn in repentant prayer to the Fury, and I wish to help her through the pain by giving her a pair of earrings to soothe her soul and eventually beckon her back to the healing table.

There is some divergence in interpretations of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03Enchiridion\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03, yet all lead towards one doctrine writ in dragon blood. Regarding magic, there are those who believe thaumaturgy puts the clergy's prayer to action, and those who believe prayer alone is sufficient to manifest the Fury's miracles. After the recent incursions by the Dravanians, I tend to favor the \xe2\x80\x9cburn and destroy\xe2\x80\x9d school of thought, and would ask you supply us with staves with which to practice fighting fire with fire.

The Disciples of the Land who follow after the Temple Knights are pioneers in their own right. There are bounties aplenty in every ilm of land we take back from the Dravanians, but there are dangers to lessen our ranks, too. Any botanist or angler who traverses uncharted territory must have protection\xe2\x94\x80shoes that can withstand sharpened rock, pants that keep deadly plants off the skin, and most importantly, goggles that shelter the eyes from dragons' foul breath.

Amidst the chaos of the wounded filling our beds from the Dravanian assault, there has been an increase in the number of calmatives disappearing from the infirmary's cabinets. While I cannot prove thieves to be responsible, the rapidly depleting stock after a single day can have no other explanation. While we try to accommodate everyone, pilfering of the physicks made from rarer ingredients could mean more for black marketeers and less for those who are in dire need. To prevent further theft, one of the younger hospitaliers came up with the brilliant idea to carry the medicines around on their person\xe2\x94\x80particularly on their ears.

A priest with a penchant for capturing the hearts of the common people through conjury of ice and fire during his recitations of Halonic scripture has requested two staves for his faithful altar boys so that they may practice and participate in the sermons. Given that his reception by the lowborn has led to increased attendance, I would pay you greatly to provide me the proper wands for thauma\xe2\x94\x80er, religious purpose.

A certain astrologian from the Athenaeum scoffed that he of great talents should not waste his time gazing at the dragon star as so many do and demanded a mythrite planisphere in the Sharlayan style for the coming uprising. The dragons roar at our gates and the old fool demands a crackpot tool of a bygone age? If he were not of House Durendaire, he would be made to walk from Witchdrop! Where in the name of Halone am I to procure such an obscure device?

column2: High Above Me, She Sews Lovely
column3: The flowers of the capital bloom even in winter, and the lack of sun upon their skin gives them a radiant glow. There is one who has caught the eye of a certain count's son, who has pleaded me to play matchmaker, yet it will be you who will sow the seed of love. For the ladies of Ishgard are known for their beautiful embroidery, and it is my intention to provide the young lass with a needle of such finery that she will return in kindness a handkerchief for the young lord. Will you be able to craft me such a piece?

As the Temple Knights' Minister of Coin, one would think I care solely for keeping the merchants of death in business. It is false, however, for I know well that a sound economy means less prayers by the commoners for what they do not have, and more devotion towards the Fury's divine command. With the recent opening of some sky routes, purveyors in the Crozier grow thirsty for what commerce lies beyond the city walls in Coerthas and the Sea of Clouds, and thus will partake in technologies owned by the manufactory to build safer ships. The increasing demand of these vessels calls for mythrite, which coats the rudders that keep the ship afloat, strengthening them against turbulent winds.

The spoiled viscount at the Astrologicum is at it again, and this time he's clamoring for more astromantic planispheres, expecting \xe2\x80\x9can impending thirst for knowledge of the Sharlayan school.\xe2\x80\x9d Bah, I've seen no such trend and besides, I know not a goldsmith in Ishgard capable of making these contraptions of which he speaks...though, a well-traveled outsider such as yourself might have stumbled across the designs in your travels. Do not worry, you shall be paid well\xe2\x94\x80Lord Jannequinard has made certain of it with the clinking of his poor father's coin.

While Ishgardian society is more or less accepting of women who wish to take up the sword in the name of the Fury, there are ladies of the manors who fiercely protect their traditional roles laid out in divine scripture, and thus are coveted as women who shine most brilliantly in their elegance, purity, and modesty. They are known to spend their days sewing tokens of their affection for Temple Knight suitors of noble blood, weaving with scented thread that lingers long after their dainty fingers had put needle to cloth. Theirs is a wellspring of morale that cannot be acquired from the rallies on the battlefield, and thus I would send them quality sewing needles to stir the hearts of our men.

Although remote, the airship landings located in the Sea of Clouds and the western highlands are two of the busiest ports in the realm. Camp Cloudtop, in particular, imports most everything to maintain daily operations. Given the perilous journey, the landings regularly receive airships with severely damaged hulls. One such emergency landing saw a ship grounded until the entire hull could be repaired with mythrite, exhausting the dock's entire supply, to which I beseech you to replenish the stock as soon as possible.

A true knight never exhausts of his divine task, yet when the Hour of the Sheath tolls, those who fought so long on the battlefield must stand aside for fresh blood. Hence it is most unfortunate when an elder knight in years of service is torn limb-from-limb mere bells before his Hour, as was the case with poor Ser Blaine of House Durendaire. Though he has no use for bangles of fending in this world, I shall see to it that when he walks in Halone's halls, She will know well of his deeds.

The inquisition unmasked a heretic amongst the astrologians in Camp Dragonhead\xe2\x94\x80a man who whispered secrets into the ears of Dravanian agents at the Steel Vigil. Upon just accusation, the traitor bounded for the gate with a stolen chocobo, and would have certainly made it to refuge had it not been for an elderly porter who threw himself at the bird's flank, causing the heretic to fall from his steed. An immediate sentencing and beheading followed, yet I feel something should be given to the unsung hero who abandoned his post in the name of Halone. Craft me a ring of hardsilver so all will know of his bravery.

Should the Horde breach our barriers, they would lay waste to our every building and silence our every child. And Saint Reymanaud Cathedral? It would most likely be the first to fall. And while it is true that her walls might be rebuilt, the relics of the great war housed in the cathedral most certainly cannot. The Holy See has decreed the reliquaries which hold these rich pieces of history to be warded in the same manner as the Steps of Faith, though on a much smaller scale. To that end, the arcanists in charge of the project have requested magnifiers so that they may properly transcribe geometric wards the size of a fingertip.

The Hour of the Sheath draws near for three elder knights who have fought bravely for almost two eras. To commemorate the valor of these honored knights and their homecoming to Ishgard to serve on the advisory councils, I would ask you to provide me hardsilver bangles that glisten so brightly that even the spires will know of their great deeds.

A change of guards for Lady Ninne of Camp Dragonhead has been issued in light of the infiltration of heretics among the garrison. The fresh team of knights shall be sent from Ishgard proper, and are expected to arrive by nightfall. The lady wishes to welcome their arrival with mormorion rings crafted with the sigil of the house they serve, and unless you prefer a lighter coinpurse, it would be unwise to refuse the request.

Not only were the outermost barriers of Daniffen's Collar broken, but those that remained are now awash with miniscule cracks, nigh impossible for the naked eye to locate. The chosen custodians of the Steps of Faith are under immense pressure to repair the intricate arcane walls posthaste, and have great need for spectacles able to magnify their vision so that they might see where new wards are needed.

No sooner had I completed preparations for vespers had I discovered the chamber was bare of a large silver handbell that pleasantly informs the friars of the sacred hour. Objects for use in the worship of the goddess must be crafted in the presence of a church official to ensure the Fury's will is properly imbued into the tool...along with drops of Her humble servant's blood. Such things cannot be freely bought and sold! Bring me ingots of hardsilver so we may replace the bell before the next observance.

A House Dzemael architect approached my office with a proposition to rebuild the Congregation Hall from its foundation. I told him that the Congregation was not in dire need of a complete renovation but when he unfolded the scroll and showed me the grand hallways, the marble columns, and the statues of our great modern warriors, my heart was aflutter. Whether or not the plans will come to be, I know not, but I do believe he deserves a pair of dragon fang earrings for his efforts.

A provisions request came across my desk from the Astrologicum sealed with wax bearing the sigil of Durendaire, and its contents were designs for a goldsmith to create the prototype for a planisphere. I can only guess who the designs came from, and I would have sooner burned the request with my candle if I followed not my first principle: coin speaks louder and truer than any tongue, and Durendaire coin is nothing to sniff at.

column2: With a Noise That Reaches Heaven (L)
column3: As I sighed over the repeated pilfering of the prayer-beckoning bell, I had an epiphany of sorts\xe2\x94\x80the soundings of the \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03hand\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03bell were sweet and mild, but a \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03clock\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03bell would be much more difficult to steal, and one crafted in the likeness of Halone's shield, encrusted with sparkling jewels and polished brighter than the sun\xe2\x94\x80now that would certainly heighten the avidity of prayer! Such a testament of the Fury's splendor cannot be had without a large quantity of hardsilver ingots. Bring them unto me, and I will see to it that the Holy See pays you well for your labors.

I have oft heard that while the artisans of House Dzemael are richly rewarded and are verily masters of their crafts, some feel their deeds are not adequately appreciated by the people of Ishgard due to the absence of shimmering armor and displays of heroism. While it is true that their contributions are made in places far quieter than fields of battle, they are every bit as important to the Holy See as those of the knights. Mayhap earrings fashioned from slain dragons will inspire them to continue their work as warriors of the saw, quarry, and hammer.

If that Jannequinard shows up at my office once more to make a case for the urgency of a symposium on Sharlayan astrology with planisphere displays for the audience, I'll visit the tomb of Saint Guenriol himself to make certain he is not rolling in it. Melting quality hardsilver into such meaningless objects seems to make them destined for the scrap pile anyway, hence I entrust the task to you. But do craft them so they can be used still for standard stargazing after the fool realizes the futility of his plan.

The chocobo hunters of Tailfeather are often left to their own devices, and we care not for their affairs lest our paths cross by accident. 'Twould seem the case as of late, as the hunters have been most helpful in loosing their arrows against Dravanians ravaging air caravans filled with knight supplies. I am most grateful for their altruism and request you to bear me a ring to present to their leader as a gift.

The Countess de Durendaire has taken up embroidery once more as a way to pass the time, and has offered to pay our coffers for a needle of profound finery in her hobby. Some say she has need of it to sew a handkerchief for a secret lover. I say whomever speaks too loud is like to find their throats slit by an assassin.

A scholar of great renown and little time for frivolities will finally complete the sacred bond with her sweetheart in none other than the scholasticate itself. She is a fairly modest woman with little taste for exquisite jewelry, yet I would have you craft me a circlet for the bride to wear upon her head on her wedding day that fits her serene posture and thirst for knowledge.

The archers of the Chocobo Forest seem fairly adept at picking off the Dravanians that harry our airships, and as a result have saved our supplies on numerous occasions. I am sure they would continue to do so if they were given some encouragement. They scratch our back, we scratch theirs\xe2\x94\x80with griffin talons.

The countess of House Haillenarte has sent out the call to all highborn ladies to gather for the Victory of One Thousand Hands\xe2\x94\x80a feat not attempted in at least half a millennium. It is a war tapestry, forty yalms wide depicting some of the most glorious battles against the Horde, with red thread turning to draconian gore and silver turning to Coerthan snowfall. While we could hardly expect \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03one thousand\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 hands to embroider the tapestry, I imagine it would take thirty ladies of House Haillenarte working from dawn to dusk for at least a year or so, and they will be in need of good gossip and strong needles if they are to complete the masterpiece.

The greenest field chirurgeons have completed their training and will soon depart Ishgard to join the front lines of battle alongside the Temple Knights. In order to commemorate their first time in the field, I would have you craft them circlets so that if their first mission proves their last (as is the case with most), at least their families will remember them in their finest.

An illness known as the Red Throat has become rife in a low corner of the Brume, and the sight of a man collapsing in the street and vomiting blood has become disturbingly common. We have been able to treat and contain the disease through the use of rubycress root, but supplies are running dangerously low. Travel afar and acquire handfuls of the roots, and you will receive a purseful of coin.

Last services have increased thricefold for the faithful who perish from the Red Throat, a disease that spreads so seamlessly that the families of those who succumbed became so fearful of its wrath so as not to attend the ceremonies of their loved ones. The teachings say the absence of one's kin prevents the deceased to return hastily to the bosom of the Fury. Thus to quell the worries of family members, the Order of the Friars Templar has taken to placing charms wrapped in a tuft of saint's breath upon the scarlet mouth of the deceased, ensuring Her protection for the living so that the last ceremony would be well-attended. After all, it is only those who have not the faith in Her divine will who will be vulnerable to the disease from within the sanctity of the church! The popularity of the service has depleted what little remnants of the grass we had left. We request a botanist to provide us with more tufts of saint's breath to keep up with the demand from bereaved families.

The fortress that Falcon's Nest will become is to be built solid and impenetrable with materials married to stone and steel, yet House Dzemael has made a rare request for lumber in constructing some building foundations. You may inquire as I did of creating frames of wood as we strive to rebuild Falcon's Nest stronger than before, yet the architects of House Dzemael explained the project was not for the Nest's defenses. You see, the commonfolk of Falcon's Nest lived simple lives, and often gave hope to the wish that they would die aged among family in the warmth of their own cabin beds. The Calamity had denied that wish from those residents of Falcon's Nest who fled in terror, buried and frozen in ever-ice. The Rook expressed its desire to reconstruct the townspeople's homes as they stood, in a solemn tribute for those who had lost their lives.

A Temple Knight commander reports from the field that he has developed an unusual cough, which I can only assume is an inflammation from breathing the noisome mists that rise from the land during a battle. While the hospitaliers most certainly mean to serve our men well, sometimes I fear the zealousness of their experiments may take a toll on the bodies of our own men over time. Nevertheless, the root of the rubycress plant is just what his ailment requires, boiled into a poultice, applied to the chest\xe2\x94\x80well, the chirurgeon will know what to do. He simply knows not where to find the plant, to which I would pay you for your trouble.

These days, the church finds itself busily preparing for the Feast Day of Saint Valeroyant, that legendary dragoon and, as some believe, the patron protector of youth. An outsider such as yourself may be unable to comprehend such reverence, but on this righteous day, it is tradition for the Temple Knights to take to the streets, passing by the residences and adorning the little ones' heads with flower crowns, intricately woven from freshly plucked tufts of saint's breath. Hence as the festivities draw nigh, the order must lose no time in braiding and blessing the protective charms, as there must be a wreath for every child in the capital. Bringing us ricks of the grass posthaste, we shall reward you most graciously.

House Dzemael beams so brightly of the work their men do on the buildings in Falcon's Nest, that their orders require them to work night and day, for the Rook did not attain such wealth and prestige without their penchant for unrivaled diligence. After the sun sets, great fires must be kept burning bright enough for them to see their work clearly and keep the wild nocturnal beasts at bay. Procure great stacks of wood to serve as kindling for the bonfires so that those artisans of stone and lumber may continue to see sharp through night's thick cover.

The infirmaries that treat the Temple Knights are afforded facilities and tools of utmost modernity and our services profit much from the High Houses' grace, though we find it is not coin that we lack. Alas, for too many years had we taken the gentian plant of Coerthas for granted, as the everwinter choked out most of the vegetation, so did the region's gentian plants perish. A simple ingredient for medicines to cure stomach pain was once in the back of our minds has now become a constant worry in terms of supply, and can only be found in the Chocobo Forest these days. Might you fly out to the region and harvest some stock to replenish our cabinets?

Dravanians have no love for the bitterdrake root, which curiously enough does not taste sour on the palate of man. How curious it is that the bane of dragonkind is the very same root which allows Ishgardian babes to grow strong in the womb, as our infirmaries often allocate it to women as a refreshing herbal tea that eases the stress of gravidity. As we have given the rest of our current stock of the root to Master Martineau for use in his experiments, the noblewomen would be sure to pay coin to the botanist who can provide more.

column2: Six Hours in a Leaky Boat
column3: Some time ago, I traveled to Cloudtop in one of the older airship holds with the men during a storm and found it to be a most miserable experience. A Temple Knight of low rank would never complain, yet when I as second commander was subject to the same conditions, I found myself shivering in my armor drenched head to foot as the wooden planks from the ship's hull seemed to drip in every direction. It was then that I gave the order to start retiring the aging transport fleets. While the Skysteel Manufactory excels in creating airships and components essential for battle, the lumber used in the transport models leaves something to be desired; light and durable but miniscule nooks and crevices caused by natural weathering and vilekin infestations make the ships almost completely porous. The engines may do a bit more heavy lifting, but caelumtree root from the Chocobo Forest is far more impervious to water. Procure me a quality stock so that I may send it to the manufactory to build new transport hulls.

A dragon claw or chocobo's talon to a soft stomach will speed a man towards his congregation with Halone unless a remedy known as Mother's Mercy is ingested in time. The medicine swiftly coats the inside of the stomach with a thick mucus, allowing the blood to clot and the wound to close. Due to the value in curing such grave wounds, Mother's Mercy is a staple of every chirurgeon's field kit. A knowledgeable botanist should be able to procure large quantities of gentian, the main ingredient which allows for clotting\xe2\x94\x80though they will need to brave the Chocobo Forest to do so, as the plant no longer grows in Coerthas.

A field chirurgeon is expected to engage in combat alongside the knights when the hour calls, yet it is he who must remain the last one standing to treat the wounded. Hence our position focuses more on rendering a dragon's biology to rebel against itself rather than challenging its strength forthwith. While collaborating with Master Martineau to find a poison that could provide aid to our chirurgeons in battle, my colleague and I have conducted field research to discover that dragons avoid one specific plant at all costs\xe2\x94\x80the bitterdrake. They not only take great pains to keep at a distance of the stuff, they also snarl at it as if it were Ishgardian. Gather for us some sprigs of bitterdrake, and take care to leave the oil on the leaves intact\xe2\x94\x80its extraction could prove useful to me and Master Martineau in our trials.

Knights spend their lives becoming a single solidified mass of the Fury's divine will, and every inch of the body speaks to that task. Our palms become calloused with the training of the sword, and our backs grow accustomed to the burden of the plate, and our necks stiff and upright in determination. However, if every waking moment is spent in rigid formality, it would allow for fatigue. Thus something as simple as taking a steaming soak in a wooden bath is one of the enjoyable pleasures our short lives can afford us. I plan to commission such a basin to allow the men stationed in the wearying conditions of Coerthas some form of rejuvenation, therefore it must be constructed from wood that can withstand the harsh elements and keep water heated for hours at a time. Lumber from the foot of the caelumtrees in the Chocobo Forest looks to be of durable quality.

column2: Your Mother Is Medicine and Your Father Is the Wild
column3: The Temple Knights have succeeded in blazing a path through the Churning Mists, allowing the spoils and bounties of areas once inaccessible to again bear fruit for the campaign. When I learned of this news, I pored over the ancient texts of my trade, and I grow excited with each passing day that lost remedies may soon be regained with the more land the knights conquer. The home of the Dravanians is tumultuous, so I look to employ a true pioneer in botany who would know the sorts of plants that may produce medicinal properties at a moment's glance.

Granted leave to peruse the Temple Knights' vaults for research, I came across a faded letter from a chirurgeon dated one hundred summers past, and its contents have my interest piqued. The medic bore witness to a crisis in which a squadron of knights had been cut off from their main supply route and driven into the arms of the enemy. Fatigued and severely malnourished, they refused to meet death, and fended off the Horde for nigh on a fortnight. The Fury, impressed by the resilience of Her faithful, answered their prayers by raising a single patch of hardy plants from the earth, which upon consumption rid them of all maladies and saw the knights' muscles bulge thricefold in a matter of moments. With their enhanced physical state, it was said they cleaved their way out with pure strength, a single stroke of the strongarm beheading three or four dragons a man! The sketch in the dilapidated letter seems to match the shape and location of the heirloom dandelion thriving in the dragons' lair, and I muse if it is the same as the miracle shrub. Pluck the dandelions from their wicked place so I may be able to extract the petals' essence and decide whether it can stimulate the humours of our men.

To rise unto victory is to know the enemy, where it sleeps, where it eats, and Ishgard's laws of war say naught about slaying a Dravanian as it feeds, as only a fool of a dragon would eat in the open. Trackers may be able to distinguish the footprints of a variety of beasts and understand their movements, but a botanist with an even keener eye will soon surmise when and where the minions of the Horde have last fed. Venture forth to the Churning Mists and produce those remnants of chewed plants along with the report of where they were found, and knights will be dispatched to take care of the second course.

With the opening of the road to the Churning Mists, there is the tantalizing possibility of plants which exist only in the Dravanian home with remedial properties not yet known to medical science. I can only leave it to imagination as to what exotic vegetation may aid and strengthen our knights until I can acquire living samples to be subject to testing.

A revered knight bested a particularly large dragon in battle, but in its dying throes, the foe took the knight's calf in its jagged jaws, shredding his armor into ribbons and inflicting a deep wound. Through our miraculous works and the will of Halone has he been saved, yet the mauled leg has become corrupted with evil humours, and grows more infected by the day. In preparation for an amputation, our chirurgeons require the milk in the stem of the heirloom dandelion, which proves an effective analgesic for surgical practices. Produce for us bouquets of the flower so that we may ease his pain and sever the rotting leg.

You can lead a dragon to poison, but you cannot make it partake of the foul stuff\xe2\x94\x80unless the dragon is unaware, that is. Botanists have been experimenting with hybrid plants that resemble those preferred by Dravanians but are infused with the toxins of the deadly bitterdrake, a plant they greet with hissing anathema for the havoc it wreaks on their bodies. To bring the conclusions to a head, they wish to employ a field botanist to gather samples of plants which are favored by the enemy.

An Ishgardian wedding is nigh, therefore I would ask you to harvest some giant artichokes for me from the floating isles. Why artichokes, you ask? Well, I shall forgive your ignorance just this once, outsider. There is a tale of a humble bride, who traveled with her knight lover to the battlefield because she did not want him to cease his cause in the name of Halone. It was there in the camp that she shirked a flowery bouquet, commenting the flowers were far too decadent and instead took an artichoke in hand. She admired its resilient and spiked exterior that enveloped the plant's soft, pure heart, and she remarked the beauty of Halone was indeed similar to this plant, and thus should be her bouquet. Many Ishgardian brides are so inspired by the tale that there are often requests of the church to place the thistles near the aisles to represent a humble but fiercely devoted deliverance to the Fury.

It is always imperative to keep one's uniform crisp, clean, and free of holes. Knights are known for keeping both their armor and smallclothes immaculate from field stains and dragon blood; however, they cannot prevent the colors of their array from gradually fading due to dirt, wind, and rain. Some say a knight is not fully a servant of Ishgard without his blue arming coat, and thus any fading attire must be replaced as per the code of conduct. Our weavers request a seasoned botanist to make for the Sea of Clouds and gather bright blueclouds, for their petals will be boiled into a dye that gives the garments their signature hue.

Temple Knights who have fallen during combat with the Dravanian Horde are given the most exquisite of funerals, for it is they who have made Her most pleased in their courageous deeds. In preparation for the knight's journey to Her halls, the body must be made suitable for the Fury's presence and therefore bathed in a fragrant oil. In recent weeks, the Order of the Friars Templar finds itself lacking of extract often, and will compensate a kind soul to travel to the floating isles to gather more for the seemingly endless string of funerals for those who perish on the battlefield.

A hand of one of the Vault's more exalted priests pleads an urgent task, but it is one that must be kept to utmost secrecy. It appears his master has developed quite the taste for deviled colibri eggs during his afternoon meal and by sunset, he is no longer able to\xe2\x94\x80ahem\xe2\x94\x80keep his silence during evening prayer. While the body has natural ways of proclaiming a cleansing of sin, the priest's...natural proclamation...is so overpowering that filling the room with clouds of incense has little effect. I sought advice on this great matter from Master Martineau, who advised the leaves from giant artichokes in the floating isles, when dried and ground into a cup of tea, can serve to calm the offending winds. The hand promised a great reward to anyone who can fetch his weight in giant artichokes for the pantry. Do hurry, as we would much prefer to save the holy incense for more\xe2\x94\x80ahem\xe2\x94\x80spiritual purposes.

The Temple Knight standard, with its brilliant azure hue, flies high to serve as a beacon in the heavens to remind Ishgardians that they must ever be vigilant. Banners made pale by the elements must be quickly replaced with ones freshly dyed so that the colors may never fade from view, else our fervor wanes in the Fury's eyes. There is naught but one flower which produces a dye rich and vibrant enough to suffice\xe2\x94\x80the bright bluecloud. Venture to the Sea of Clouds and procure as many as you can so that our banners may be dipped in a valor that withstands the test of time.

I fondly recall when the church would hold an anointing service, whence sweet-scented nectar was rubbed lightly onto the forearms as a way of making one presentable in their prayers. Alas, I wonder if those days are history, as the flower which provided the nectar has been driven nearly to extinction sithence Coerthas has withered under winter's icy grasp. If only a suitable alternative could be found! I wish to employ a skilled botanist to travel to the Sea of Clouds to collect flower samples for me so I might try and revive the service.

While the knights move forward with their plans to set up watchtowers along the western side of the hinterlands, the location appears to be far too removed from any roads along which house caravans can bring necessary supplies. I want you to survey the land and ascertain what resources we can freely use to fortify our positions and which will have to be brought in by airship with a dedicated guard.

A particularly bloody encounter with the Horde has left scores of our knights fighting for their lives. If we are to save them, we must replenish our stores of a blood-staunching draft, the brewing of which requires the root of a bush called Thaliak's thumb. Go to the Dravanian hinterlands and harvest as many of these roots as you can.

column2: A Taste of Their Own Medicine
column3: The Gnath will fiercely protect their territory and lack not for ingenuity in their first line of defense\xe2\x94\x80putrid smoke screens that emit fog and indelibly blacken Dravanian lungs when inhaled, forcing such strenuosity on the beasts that they drop from the sky as if boulders were set upon their backs. While the dragons have learned to give a wide berth to the Gnathic miasmas, our knights may be able to ground Horde scouts with our own variation. The Congregation seeks the services of one with knowledge of deadly flora to scour the hinterlands and find samples which will cause our foes pain everlasting.

The Congregation has become painfully aware of increased Dravanian activity on the western side of the hinterlands\xe2\x94\x80the mangled and scorched corpses of valuable scouts telling a grim tale of draconian savagery. With their sacrifice, the need for concealed lookout posts has become crystal clear. Until the scouts' thinned ranks are replenished, however, the companies will remain unable to survey the area themselves. Someone unaffiliated, such as yourself, may be able to seek out a suitable location for a watchtower undetected and discern if local resources might be used in its construction.

A chocobo breeder has made an urgent request from the battlefield for bushels of Thaliak's thumb, a herb used to treat gaping wounds that are in threat of bleeding out. While I know not of the reasons why he is unable to secure his own stock, I dare not refuse the request, for it is known that one military chocobo is worth three men on the field of battle. Travel to the Dravanian hinterlands and gather Thaliak's thumb roots in haste, and worry not of the expense, I shall ensure you are paid well.

The Temple Knights are looking into development of smoke candles that, when lit in proper conditions, will irritate dragon eyes and conceal the movement and numbers of our companies. Dravanians cannot make use of protective masks as our men can, so to utilize the power of smoke is to our advantage. I am certain there are plants in the wild that can be dried and lit to produce a thick enough haze, hence should you have interest in a good amount of coin, the order is looking for someone who can provide them with smoke-producing plants that might serve as viable candidates.

A young noble from House Fortemps (emboldened by ale) recently made japes about the pace of Falcon's Nest's construction, saying the artisans could have the project's stone bound to their feet and one would see nary a difference in progress. As expected, House Dzemael went on the offensive and announced the commissioned cargo shipments of stone from House Fortemps would no longer be required as the Rook would open its own quarry in Falcon's Nest within the sennight. Any man knows better than to find himself twixt a pair of squabbling nobles, but I do agree it would do Falcon's Nest some good to rely less on the risks of long-distance transport. Provide me with samples from possible areas where the quarry may be dug.

Some hundred summers past, the Holy See decreed twelve towers be built, monuments to each of the first Heavens' Ward. So inspired were the Ishgardian people by the spires' majesty, many embarked on pilgrimages to each tower during the warmer moons. Wind, hellfire, and the pillaging hands of the zealous lowborn have since seen those spiritual citadels reduced to ruin, and now only the Ninth Vare continues its silent vigil. The order yearns to restore the towers to their former glory so the faithful may again bask in the mightiness of the church. Secure slabs of stone to commence the virtuous task of rebuilding, so the people of Ishgard may once again be compelled to walk the path of the holy.

I am certain you have noticed the dark stone beacons placed on the sides of the road. They were used when Falcon's Nest was populated by more children than broadswords to light the roads and guide villagers home after toiling the fields. They have, however, been in disuse since the Calamity, and rather than have them merely sit there slowly eroding away, I would see the stone retrieved and repurposed for rebuilding the hamlet. I leave you with the task of dismantling pieces of the beacons to see if we can salvage some of the materials for our current reconstruction.

The rebuilding of Falcon's Nest will not soon be complete, therefore House Dzemael recognizes it would do well to have its own blacksmith and forge to quickly and efficiently craft the myriad nails and tools required for the reconstruction. Not every building is suited for a furnace that burns hotter than Ifrit's maw, hence the task falls to you to provide me with samples of possible locations where the forge may be established.

The church takes great pains to reach out and provide spiritual comfort to men of every class, yet even among the lowborn does treachery fester and boil. I did not see it myself, but an impoverished heretic knelt before the church and cried out that the blood of Ishgard's youth was on the church's hands before slitting his throat and falling forward onto the steps of Saint Reymanaud. Though the friars thoroughly scrubbed the steps after the incident, the taint and hushed rumors yet linger. Hence we raise the call for miners to bring us more stone so that we may replace the steps entirely and wash our hands of this matter.

Since my arrival in Falcon's Nest, not once have I seen lit the beacons which line the road to the hamlet. What I \x02\x1a\x02\x02\x03do\x02\x1a\x02\x01\x03 see are laborers toiling to repair the disused waymarks\xe2\x94\x80something I believe is a waste of precious time and resources. I would rather the stone be used in the hamlet's reconstruction and seek able bodies to assist in the demolishing of the aged lanterns, bringing back whatever pieces they are able to salvage.

column2: Permit for Destruction of Religious Property
column3: There have been disturbing reports that vandals have carved insults of the Fury into the ruins in the Chocobo Forest. The lords will not stand for it, and demand that the offending sections of these ruins are destroyed completely. Bring me evidence of the deed, and you will be handsomely rewarded.

column2: I'll Show You My Battle Shards
column3: The Skysteel Manufactory has developed a new cannon\xe2\x94\x80one which shows much promise. While Big Bertha is our beloved standard, she is limited in her talents. This prototype, however, provides us with enhanced killing power, for it fires shells containing scores of tiny metal shards and lightning sprite cores, which upon striking a target burst forth into a fan of death, aspected shrapnel shredding scale, flesh, and bone. The metal will stop the advance of the foe, but it is the lightning cores that deliver the killing blow. After the target is gravely gored, the cores shock the heart with such a jolt that it can strike a dragon dead before our knights even reach the beast. Trials on Dravanian corpses have met with much success, and the manufactory is ready to craft mass quantities of the ammunition. We call for seasoned miners to dig out precious chunks of lancite from the cliffs in the Dravanian forelands to commence production.

Among the dusty tomes of the church library, I discovered a sacred contraption lost to time\xe2\x94\x80a set of complex and beautifully ornate metal boxes intended for none but the most exalted. He would be seated with hands and feet shackled and his head held pointed to the sky, propped up with a tightened iron collar. The only light that penetrates the dark casket is shone through a large star sapphire, set into the top of the box. When the morning light hits the stone just right, it reflects its radiance into the holy man's eyes, and allows him to see a grand vision from paradise. The tome's excerpt said a handful of priests in history have even been given the gift of a vision so holy that their eyes are burnt blue and can see the dregs and impurity of this world no longer! The ornate boxes have already arrived from Ishgard's finest artisans, but I yet require star sapphires large enough to bathe our eyes in Her merciful light. I will pay a hefty price to any mineral hunter who can bring me the largest sapphires in the Chocobo Forest.

O Halone, what have I done to deserve such animosity? I find myself caught in the middle of the nobles' squabbling and there is need to rectify it, else one or the other might curb their generous flow of gold to the knights' coffers! It would seem an ancient site defiled by heretics and ordered to be destroyed by House Durendaire was ancestral to House Haillenarte, and thus under their wardship. The House of the Rose is furious because of the order and demands what rubble is left of the slandered site to be exhumed and brought back to Ishgard for tribute and safekeeping.
