And here I thought the Friars Templar would be the brunt of my worries. I beseech you, please, return to the site and extract what remains of the relics so that this dispute may be put to rest. I'll pay you double if you stay silent.

Lancite, so named for its use in our city-state's weapon of choice, is one of the few ores capable of penetrating Dravanian scales. In preparation for the initiation ceremony for new recruits into the Knights Dragoon, the Skysteel Manufactory has requested a large order of the ore so they, in collaboration with the Order of the Friars Templar, may begin the ritualistic process of forging. Make for the Dravanian forelands and cut out great chunks, and the manufactory shall reward you fairly.

There is a well-known excerpt in Halonic teachings which states, \xe2\x80\x9cIf thou hath not suffered much of battlefields, worry not of the Fury's discontent, for in Her halls may yet be thy sanctuary. Grasp in thine hand a coarse sapphire and paint thy mind with those who forsaketh Her name. Should thy wish be pure, the stone's surface shalt smooth in time, and grant thee a vision of Halone's halls, O Fury's gift, sated by thy wish.\xe2\x80\x9d While the stone resembles a lifetime of \xe2\x80\x9cpolishing\xe2\x80\x9d dedication and prayer, so inspired are the nobles of the High Houses that they never tire of their want for star sapphires fashioned into rosaries and decadent adornments worn from head to toe. Of course, none but the church can provide baubles of saving grace that have been properly blessed (and hence taxed accordingly). I shall pay you in full should you bring me quality star sapphires so that those gentle lords and ladies may be given some salvation from the comfort of their homes, in lieu of joining the battle.

The Temple Knights are considering establishing a checkpoint in the Churning Mists, but needs know more about the foreign landscape. For a successful establishment, an area must have its share of hills and craggy outcrops to provide a watchtower with ample cover, yet flat enough to provide a stable foundation. The Congregation seeks to commission one capable of conducting a geological survey and bringing soil samples for use in a new informative map.

column2: Dreams of War, Dreams of Liars, Dreams of Dragon Fire
column3: As legends would have it, the swords and pikes which brought forth the birth of our nation were forged in the likeness of the Fury's own. Every true Ishgardian knows the holy scriptures speak of dust that falls from Halone's slumbered eyes into the bowels of the realm as She is stirred by the prayers of Her people. It was with handfuls of that sacred sand that the great weapons of the Twelve were created, and it was those weapons that rendered Nidhogg impotent. While the stories speak of Halone's dust, the Twelve's arms are a stark reality, and real swords smelt with real sand. It's quite possible those ancient tools of death were forged with the sand extracted from the outcrops in the Sea of Clouds, which only a miner with considerable skill could attain. The Temple Knights would pay handsomely for handfuls of the sand, as the demand for such weapons would be insatiable were formidable replicas forged.

The Holy See, while having faith in those who would lay down their lives in the name of Halone's divine task, would trust no other than the Order of the Friars Templar to examine and appraise the value of any ancient relics found in Dravanian lands, as these items belong to the church, and the church alone. An outsider's natural neutrality in such matters may prove useful, and I would ask you to bring back any items of historical note that you may find. I would procure the relics myself, but you see, the very air of the Mists chokes with such sacrilege that it would render me to my knees upon setting foot in the domain of the Dravanians.

column2: All of These Bases Belong to Us (L)
column3: With our knights' recent victory in claiming their first foothold in the Churning Mists, their ambition burns ever brighter to establish more bases close enough to the Dravanians' domain to monitor their activities but distant enough to remain undetected. An opportunity for employment has been extended for a survey of the lands so that we might find suitable locations for these future outposts.

While crystals can oft serve as a much-needed source of potable water, when traveling to places devoid of aetherial manifestations, one must rely on existing water resources\xe2\x94\x80including those that do not always exhibit the highest of purities. The sand from the Sea of Clouds has a particular quality which allows water to drain through, removing impurities that may lead to sickness. In the wilds where filthy beasts are prone to drool and piss in watering holes, the properties of the sand are naught less than a godssend.

It would seem the Temple Knights have cleared a path in the Churning Mists near an ancient cavern said to be thousands of years older than our nation's birth. To my dismay, they have begun thoroughly inspecting the reclaimed site without close observance nor approval from the Order of the Friars Templar! It is we who are the custodians of the church's sacred Halonic history! It is we who should be the ones to carefully scrutinize and preserve the ancient word and ensure our modern teachings hold no inconsistencies with those clues of the past. Unbeliever, you are blissfully ignorant to those pieces which may be a key to returning to Halone's embrace. Make for the Churning Mists and secure any relics you may find before any other can take hold of them. In the meantime, I shall write a letter to the lord commander to notify him of this blatant breach of post.

The Rose Knights have relayed a peculiar message that a bright-red ore with the consistency of rare furite has been found plentiful in locations of the floating isles in the Sea of Clouds. The question that arises to my lips is if it smelts as furite, strikes as furite, can it be marked off as furite? I seek a miner who can bring us copious amounts of the questionable ore that our forges may attest to its quality.

The Skysteel Manufactory sees in shades of victory, yet in the case of airships, the descent from the skies can only go two ways\xe2\x94\x80gently or violently. The engineers are currently researching an emergency power reserve to keep our airships afloat even after a hull has sustained grave damage, granting more time to make a gradual crash descent and allow our men to fight another day. According to one of the engineers, minerals with intense wind properties could enhance the ship's buoyancy and put less strain on the engine in such an emergency. The manufactory requests pinches of lightsand from the Sea of Clouds' floating isles to use as samples in their prototypes.

In response to the wyvern attack not long ago, the Temple Knights have begun reinforcing the more prominent structures of Ishgard. In turn, the nobles have expressed concern that, should the dragons attack again, the new fortifications would rain down on their homes, and have therefore asked the knights to consider the construction of \xe2\x80\x9csafe chambers\xe2\x80\x9d below each and every house, within which the nobles could take shelter should the need arise. I expressed my doubt towards this plan, observing that the chambers would merely serve as their tombs\xe2\x94\x80to which they retorted that if the reinforcements were constructed with a light material such as pumice, they needn't worry for their homes. It was at this time I simply stopped caring and agreed to their ridiculous request. Travel to the Sea of Clouds and mine for Dravanian pumice to see the entitled happy.

Halone smiles upon us today, for when I showed a veteran miner recently acquired samples of an unidentified ore, he squinted at the rock and excitedly told me it was verily the furite of legend. If that be the case, then it is the Temple Knights who shall profit from the extraction of the vein. Hurry now, and gather carts of the ore before others rush to the node and exhaust it of all its bounty!

The Skysteel Manufactory is currently developing a lightweight mammet which, when outfitted with wind-aspected sand, will be able to fly. If it is coin you desire, I would grant employment unto you to fill the manufactory's order for pinches of lightsand, which can be mined from crags in the floating isles.

When asked to describe Ishgard, most outsiders will recall the lofty lance-like spires that pierce the very Sea of Clouds. Yet Ishgardians themselves, who routinely turn their eyes to the skies in passionate prayer, pay the centuries-old constructs no mind. Halone forfend if the Horde would happen to breach the gates and thrash large slabs to crumble and fall upon the heads of our noble ladies and their babes, a scenario more likely in these troubled times. The Holy See has approved the Temple Knights' request to fortify Ishgard's most iconic structures, and the project requires reinforced mortar strong enough to allow the spires to withstand a Dravanian's aerial bombardment. Pluck slabs of pumice from the crags in the Sea of Clouds and bring them hither so that they might be used to create such a substance.

Elder members of the Knights Dragoon are known to prefer lances smithed from pommel ore\xe2\x94\x80a hard substance that, while difficult to work, is believed to make the finest, sharpest heads. Unfortunately, the locations of the few remaining veins in Dravania were known only to the Sharlayans who took the information back with them to the Old World fifteen summers ago. If you were to find a vein of decent quality, I would pay much for the material.

The stained crystal adorning the buildings of the Holy See marks the sincere devotion of Ishgard's artisans in its most beautiful manifestation. While we of the Order do our best to preserve them, time loosens the ancient frames that hold the pieces, leaving them to rattle and chip in the wind. The Holy See wishes to start a grand-scale restoration of these works of art and has cast the locks off its coffers to see the finest materials are prepared for the task. Crystal with the right amount of transparency has been found, but due to the remoteness of the location, only miners with considerable experience are being sought to extract it.

I never cease to be impressed by the buildings in Sharlayan, made of sturdy stone and vastly different from the architecture of the Pillars. Ere it was abandoned, the city-state was known for effective fortification techniques to protect their scholars against Horde attacks. Mayhap there is knowledge yet to be found within those walls to fortify our own bulwarks. Journey to the Dravanian hinterlands and bring back samples of Sharlayan flagstone so I may better learn what kind of materials were used.

Our robust trade with the inhabitants of Sharlayan provided us with copious amounts of pommel ore, which on parchment was said to be smithed for peaceful tools to sate the trader agreements (but eventually made its way to the bolts of our dragonkiller ballistas for many years). Following the scholars' exodus, the fountain of metal has since run dry, and we must now search for our own veins of the precious ore. Search the areas around the Daggers of the Dravanian hinterlands for the material. With luck, you will mayhap locate one of the lost lodes.

Halone forgive, this absolutely will not do! The Holy See has ordered a grand restoration of the stained crystal windows of the church, but the last miner I commissioned brought in stained crystal in quality that is much too hedonistic! If excess of white light is allowed into the church, then the eyes of the prayer-bearers will become more focused on the rays reflected on the fairer sex instead of upwards towards the heavens, thus vanity will distract from our faith when the Fury demands the eyes of all men! Bring me the right stained crystal and I shall pay you double what we paid the last miner. In the meantime, I suppose I will send this wasted batch to the inquisitor's quarters\xe2\x94\x80they never seem to decline refuse of the sharp, broken variety.

While the inhabitants of Sharlayan held an abhorrence of our war with the Dravanians, the style of their architecture speaks of more than neutrality. Rumors have spread among the denizens of camp about secret sympathies of the scholars towards the dragons, which was written in code on the walls of their buildings. I find these to be absolute rot, and ask of you to bring back pieces of Sharlayan flagstone so I may put such conspiracies to rest.

column2: Please Halone, Tell Me I'm Still Asleep
column3: Upon discussion with one of the priests of the church, some of the younger acolytes have been creating a distraction by drifting off during particularly heavy sessions of prayer. It appears that inexperienced faithbringers who are not yet in full control of their intense worship can become lost in their minds, eyes rolling and gesturing widely as they fall entranced in their Halonic visions. 'Twould seem that the masters want of something with a sharp enough pinch to pull them back into the real world. I told him nothing brings about a reality-inducing pinch quite like a Coerthan crab tied to a stick, and he seems willing to pay quite a bit of coin for a basketful.

There had been curious rumors in the Forgotten Knight of a farm family on the outskirts of the capital claiming to be channeling the voice of Halone. It is a truly preposterous notion, for common knowledge dictates that only the high clergymen of the church have such a spiritual channel! Worship of Halone of any kind is not considered heresy, so upon a knight investigation, it was discovered the voices were not that of the Fury, but small insects called whisperworms that crawl into ears from bathing buckets and twitch at people's brains. There's no curing this family, but the worms' natural predator, blueclaw shrimp, could be dropped into the well to prevent anyone else from such unfortunate circumstance.

The nobles who reside in Camp Dragonhead have little in the form of leisure that they oft must take it upon themselves to find some form of entertainment. Upon his supper of urchin rolling onto the floor by mistake, it appears one of them had the notion to form teams to kick the spiny ball around. He asks for the prickliest specimens you can find to use for practice balls.

Some of the smallfolk have witnessed the use of Coerthan crabs in keeping the priests alert in their prayers, misunderstanding it as some new ritual for connecting with the Fury. There have been requests for the same treatment during church services, and I would have refused them had they not offered to pay coin. A barrel full of the little pinchers, if you will.

'Twould seem the city's waterways have become contaminated with whisperworms\xe2\x94\x80tiny creatures that crawl into a man's ears during bathing and cloud his mind, convincing him he is hearing voices. If the worms grow in number, half of Ishgard could be rendered mad. The only way to get rid of such annoyances is to drop blueclaw shrimp into the sewers and pray to Halone that they eat their fill and cleanse the water of pests.

A spineball tournament is to take place at Camp Dragonhead, wherein two teams of residents will kick around a spiny lake urchin and see if they can get it into a barrel using only their boots. I can only imagine the look on the head chirurgeon's face the next day, but as they say: \xe2\x80\x9cThe most primitive form of entertainment is watching others in pain.\xe2\x80\x9d

The injured and broken bodies of knights cannot live with the meager rations of the knights, especially if there is a good chance for survival. Hence I have special permission from the Holy See to procure diets for them that will allow them to return to the battlefield as soon as possible. The three-lipped carp is a fine source of nourishment and I would have the wounded prioritize their strength over prayer, and the anglers bring naught but the plumpest for supper.

As House Dzemael toils to restore Falcon's Nest to its former glory, the carpenters employed seek to restore the villagers' charred furnishings to their former glory. The Rook is known for their obsessions in both detail and practicality, and consultations with surviving visitors tell of using grass carp oil as a veneer to glue pieces of wood together in their armoires. Mayhap you can gather some to abet the restoration efforts?

column2: Bounty of Sky, Bounty of Earth
column3: If crops could be grown in the soil near Camp Cloudtop, what need would there be to send food provisions? In speaking with a knowledgeable botanist for advice on the matter, I was told that the flesh of the cloudfish could serve as fertilizer to grow a wide variety of vegetables. This claim amuses, as well as intrigues me, and I would ask a formidable angler to provide samples to test the botanist's theory.

I believe not in the nonsense of the ill fasting for the sake of Halone's mercy. While those knights who feel humiliated of their injuries may find spiritual comfort in it, naught but a steady diet will see them back to their duty. I ask you to gather me three-lipped carp so that they may eat well, restore their strength, and return to their duties hale and healthy.

House Dzemael's carpenters, in consultation with the residents of Falcon's Nest, have been working to refurnish the hamlet, its buildings gutted by the fires of the Calamity. The designs most requested seem to be pre-Calamity, when many pieces of furniture were covered in a special veneer created from grass carp, of all things.

Appalled by the lack of gourmet meals for a visiting priest, the Holy See is sending a culinarian of remarkable prestige to Camp Cloudtop to determine what quality cuisine can be prepared with local ingredients. Although rumor has it the woman is so talented that she can turn dung into delicacy, I propose we start with more edible prospects\xe2\x94\x80fetch me a bevy of cloudfish to determine whether the wavekin can be transformed into something palatable.

My counterpart in House Haillenarte has sent me a curious report, noting that the barbarian Vanu Vanu prize the tendrils of the mahu wai in repairing damaged nerves and paralyzed limbs. I know not of this fish or where it can be found, but it may be a rumor worth testing if you are successful in catching a handful of the creatures.

A lord from House Fortemps who guides wealth to our strongboxes is also a self-proclaimed naturalist who spends copious amounts of free time flipping through the drawings of dusty tomes, looking for exotic fish of Eorzea to add to his luxurious aqua garden. Whether his collection leads to viable research I care not, I simply seek an angler to stock him with whatever bizarre fauna he desires so as to keep his mood charitable.

The day of remembrance for fallen knights is close at hand, and every member of every house has lost at least one of their kin in the noble cause in the name of Halone. House Fortemps seeks to decorate the manor with a display of pride for the thousand years of service their knights have done our capital, and for the temporary memorial have requested wavekin that bear colors similar to the uniforms of the knights.

column2: Send a Feeling to My Spine (L)
column3: The Dravanians have started using a particularly cruel tactic in their attacks\xe2\x94\x80snapping the backbones of our men and leaving them to suffer until dead. The Vanu Vanu have been known to use the appendages of the mahu wai wavekin to treat paralysis, and I would pay you good coin for several specimens with particularly plump fins.

A House Haillenarte noble-turned-naturalist caught wind of my intentions to gift a House Fortemps rival with aquatic specimens not yet part of his collection and demanded unto me that whatever new species his rival adds, he will pay double the coin for three. While I am somewhat beside myself for being caught in the act, it is probably in both of our interests to take advantage of this animosity.

The merchants of the Crozier hear tell that blue cloud coral\xe2\x94\x80prized for the beautiful hue reminiscent of the Temple Knights' standard\xe2\x94\x80has become a most highly sought-after luxury item of the nobles of Ishgard, who buy up the material to decorate their personal water gardens and aquariums. If the Crozier merchants are profiting that much from the fad, then I do not see why we could not divert some of that coin to a more noble cause.

Now that a path into the Churning Mists has been forged, the infantrymen in the hold have commenced in a survey of the land and how our enemy lives from it. I would have you travel to the area to fish the ponds and rivers for wavekin that may serve as nourishment for the Dravanians.

It is said the dragons breathe malefic magicks upon their ancient scalekin cousins, turning the creatures into mindless slaves of the Horde. Why is it that scalekin are so susceptible to control? Could it be something in their blood? 'Twould be a fool's errand to attempt to capture a turned archaeosaur to learn of its temperament. Naturalists, however, have suggested the brown bolo as an alternative\xe2\x94\x80the latter being far easier to manage and pick apart.

The Congregation is preparing a celebratory feast for the formation of the new volunteer militia. However, with the increase in numbers, we have not the coin to treat every citizen to the recipes utilized at the banquets reserved for Temple Knight anointments. We must needs find a bountiful fish that the cooks can use to fill the initiates' plates. Pipira pira ought to be found in droves. Might I ask you to fetch me some?

column2: Hundred Fins for a Hundred Wings (L)
column3: The hundred fin which swims about the Churning Mists is said to be a favorite of the Horde, and according to the field anglers accompanying the exploration parties, it seems to be the only fish they eat as part of their daily diet. A starving dragon is as good as a dead dragon, so we would have you fish as many of the hundred fin as you can so that their population might be depleted.

With the opening of the Churning Mists, more curious fishermen have stumbled upon the terrain unprepared for what lies above. Therefore, the predatory brown bolo have acquired a taste and grown fat on eyes, noses, and lips, leaving the area littered with faceless corpses. Make for the Mists and cull the population of brown bolo before they grow larger and become a pest even knights would have to contend with.

column2: Plus One or Two or Three (L)
column3: While a banquet provided by the Temple Knights was meant to be only for those already enlisted in the volunteer militia, it appears that the invitation list has increased threefold upon insistence that families be allowed to the event as well. Everyone enjoys a free meal, I suppose, yet it also means the main dish of pipira pira will need to be tripled in order to feed all the guests.

The fountfish can spew a jet of water nearly four yalms, and with such force that it can breach the skin and cause injury. We, however, utilize it for a much more useful purpose: the quelling of flames brought on by the Horde. The Temple Knights seek to create spawning pools within the capital walls and request fish that could be used as the first wave of breeding stock.

column2: They Call It the Kissing Disease
column3: While the flesh of fish is widely known to restore the strength of the ailing, few know that the shell of the yalm lobster can be ground into a poultice and absorbed into the chest, breaking apart the gummy humours in the lungs. As it just so happens, a foul cough has been spreading through House Valentione\xe2\x94\x80as a result of what I can only imagine to be excess affection between overzealous lovers\xe2\x94\x80and I have need of the shells to see the ailment cured.

If rumors are to be believed, there are fish in Azys Lla known as bullwhips who jump and thrash when but a mere drop of dragon blood\xe2\x94\x80sweet as nectar to their palate\xe2\x94\x80falls in their vicinity. I shiver with delight when I hear this, for it means a quicker way to discern an accused heretic. Could I trouble you to bring me some fresh specimens to test the theory? Do not take pains to feed them. We have plenty of food available.

Upon witnessing the wavekin's ability to cast water through the air, a high-ranking cardinal ordered pools of the recently discovered fountfish placed atop every home in the Pillars, declaring that the fish would save Ishgard from the flames of the Horde. Coin to fund this grand undertaking was diverted from a new Brume orphanage, but the Vault still requires someone to actually catch and deliver barrels of the wavekin back to the capital.

An outbreak of boils in the Pillars has caused the demand for yalm lobster to skyrocket. The price of one has increased to that of three, and 'twould seem much more logical to simply forsake the middle man and commission an angler myself to procure the shells needed for medicine.

column2: What Does Not Break Us, Devours Us (L)
column3: My colleagues and I have heard that a fish of unsurpassed ferocity can be found in Azys Lla. The bullwhip, it is called, and but one of the creature is said to be as deadly as a whole school of pipira pira. We believe that this fish will be of great help to us as we do the Fury's work, and blessings be upon he who furnishes us with them.
